entries.name: Wealth
entries: Wealth appears in many forms in a D&D world. Coins, gemstones, trade goods, art objects, animals, and property can reflect your character's financial well-being. Members of the peasantry trade in goods, bartering for what they need and paying taxes in grain and cheese. Members of the nobility trade in legal rights, such as the rights to mine, a port, or farmland, or in gold bars, measuring gold by the pound rather than by the coin. Only merchants, adventurers, and those offering professional services for hire deal in coins.

entries.name: Coinage
entries: Common coins come in several different denominations based on the relative worth of the metal from which they are made. The three most common coins are the gold piece (gp), the silver piece (sp), and the copper piece (cp).

With one gold piece, a character can buy a quiver, 50 feet of good rope, or a goat. A skilled (but not exceptional) artisan can earn one gold piece a day. The gold piece is the standard unit of measure for wealth, even if the coin itself is not commonly used. When merchants discuss deals that involve goods or services worth hundreds or thousands of gold pieces, the transactions don't usually involve the exchange of individual coins. Rather, the gold piece is a standard measure of value, and the actual exchange is in gold bars, letters of credit, or valuable goods.
One gold piece is worth ten silver pieces, the most prevalent coin among commoners. A silver piece buys a set of dice, a flask of lamp oil, or a night's rest in a poor inn.
One silver piece is worth ten copper pieces, which are common among laborers and beggars. A single copper piece buys a candle, a torch, or a piece of chalk.

In addition, unusual coins made of other precious metals sometimes appear in treasure hoards. The electrum piece (ep) and the platinum piece (pp) originate from fallen empires and lost kingdoms, and they sometimes arouse suspicion and skepticism when used in transactions. An electrum piece is worth five silver pieces, and a platinum piece is worth ten gold pieces.
A standard coin weighs about a third of an ounce, so fifty coins weigh a pound.

entries.name: Selling Treasure
entries: Opportunities abound to find treasure, equipment, weapons, armor, and more in the dungeons you explore. Normally, you can sell your treasures and trinkets when you return to a town or other settlement, provided that you can find buyers and merchants interested in your loot.

entries.name: Arms, Armor, and Other Equipment
entries: As a general rule, undamaged weapons, armor, and other equipment fetch half their cost when sold in a market. Weapons and armor used by monsters are rarely in good enough condition to sell.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: Selling magic items is problematic. Finding someone to buy a potion or a scroll isn't too hard, but other items are out of the realm of most but the wealthiest nobles. Likewise, aside from a few common magic items, you won't normally come across magic items or spells to purchase. The value of magic is far beyond simple gold and should always be treated as such.

entries.name: Gems, Jewelry, and Art Objects
entries: These items retain their full value in the marketplace, and you can either trade them in for coin or use them as currency for other transactions. For exceptionally valuable treasures, the DM might require you to find a buyer in a large town or larger community first.

entries.name: Trade Goods
entries: Most wealth is not in coins. It is measured in livestock, grain, land, rights to collect taxes, or rights to resources (such as a mine or a forest).

entries.name: 護甲與盾牌
entries: D&D世界是一個由許多不同文明交織而成的巨大織物，且每個文明都有著不同的科技水平。因此，冒險者們可能會接觸到各種不同類型的護甲，從皮甲到鎖子甲，甚至是昂貴的全身板甲，以及許許多多介於其中的護甲種類。護甲表收集了遊戲中最常見的護甲種類，並將它們分成了三個類別：輕甲、中甲、和重甲。此外，許多勇士們還會為他們的護甲再配備一面盾牌。
護甲表記錄了D&D世界中各種常見的護甲種類，以及其相應的價格、重量、以及其他屬性。

entries.name: 護甲熟練
entries: 任何人都可以隨意地穿上一套護甲或在手腕上配備一面盾牌。然而，只有那些熟練於護甲的人懂得如何有效地使用它們。
你的職業會賦予你特定類別護甲的熟練項。若你穿著你不具有熟練項的護甲時，你將在任何涉及力量或敏捷的屬性檢定、豁免檢定、和攻擊檢定中具有劣勢，且你將無法施放法術。

entries.name: 護甲等級 (AC)
entries: 護甲能夠從攻擊中保護其穿著者。你所穿戴的護甲（和盾牌）將決定你的基礎護甲等級。

entries.name: 重甲
entries: 沉重的護甲會妨礙其穿著者在迅速、隱匿、和自由行動上的能力。若護甲表在某個護甲種類的力量需求欄位中紀錄了「力量13」或「力量15」的內容，則除非穿著者的力量值等於或高於其列出的數值，否則該穿著者的移動速度將減少10呎。

entries.name: 隱匿
entries: 若護甲表在隱匿欄位中標記了「劣勢」，則其穿著者將在敏捷（隱匿）檢定上具有劣勢。

entries.name: 盾牌
entries: 盾牌由木頭或金屬打造，且可以用一隻手攜帶。持握一面盾牌會增加你的護甲等級2點。你同時只能受益於一面盾牌的效果。

entries.name: 變體：裝備尺寸
entries: 在大部分的戰役中，只要在合理範圍內，你就可以使用或穿戴任何你在冒險中發現的裝備。舉例來說，一名魁梧的半獸人不太可能穿上一件半身人的皮甲，而一名地侏則很有可能會完全沒入一件雲巨人的典雅長袍之中。
DM可以選擇加入更多的真實感。例如，一套為了某個人類量身打造的全身板甲，在經過明顯改動之前可能無法合身於另一個人。而當冒險者試圖穿上守衛制服以進行偽裝時，也可能會讓人看出明顯不合身的狀況。
若使用這個變體規則，則當冒險者發現任何護甲、衣物、和其他類似物品時，他們可能會需要光顧某個護甲匠、裁縫、皮匠、或其他類似專家才能使該物品得以被穿戴。這類工程的價碼大約為該物品市價的10到40%。DM也可以骰 1d4x10 決定，或根據該物品所需改動的範圍以決定具體的價格。

entries.name: 輕甲
entries: 大部分由輕薄的材料所製成，由於其能在不犧牲機動性的前提下提供一定程度的防護，因此輕甲相當受到注重靈巧的冒險者所喜愛。若你穿著輕甲，則將你的敏捷調整值加入你護甲類型所提供的基礎數值中，以決定你的護甲等級。

entries.name: 綿甲
entries: 綿甲是由一層層縫起的布料和棉絮所製成。

entries.name: 皮甲
entries: 這套護甲的護胸和肩甲是由浸泡過滾油而硬化的皮革製成。護甲的其他部分則是用較柔軟且具彈性的材料製作。

entries.name: 鑲釘皮甲
entries: 由強韌而柔軟的皮革製成，鑲釘皮甲被以緊密的鉚釘或尖刺進一步強化。

entries.name: 中甲
entries: 中甲能提供比輕甲更多的防護，但同時也放棄了部分的移動性。若你穿著中甲，則將你的敏捷調整值（最大為+2）加入你護甲類型所提供的基礎數值中，以決定你的護甲等級。

entries.name: 生皮甲
entries: 這套粗糙的護甲由厚毛和生皮製成。它常見於蠻人部族，邪惡類人，和其他因欠缺適當的工具和材料而無法製造較好防具的族群。

entries.name: 鏈甲衫
entries: 由交織的鐵環製成，鏈甲衫被穿在層層布料或皮革之間。這套護甲為穿戴者的上半身提供了適當的保護，且透過外層衣物蒙住鐵環彼此摩擦所發出的聲音。

entries.name: 鱗甲
entries: 這套護甲由皮革製的上衣及綁腿（或許還帶有一件短裙）構成，皮革表面覆蓋著彼此交疊的金屬片，就像是魚鱗一樣。整套護甲還包含了一雙鐵手套。

entries.name: 護胸甲
entries: 這套護甲是由一塊墊著柔軟皮革的合身鐵製胸板所構成。雖然它相對來說保護不了手和腳，但這套護甲能在為穿載者的重要器官提供良好保護的同時，而不太會妨礙穿載者的行動。

entries.name: 半身板甲
entries: 半身板甲由一片片特別形狀的鐵板所構成，覆蓋穿載者大部分的上半身。它對腿部提供的保護僅止於以皮帶固定的護脛。

entries.name: 重甲
entries: 在所有的護甲種類中，重甲能提供最良好的防護效果。這些護甲套裝覆蓋了整個身體，並被設計於擋下各式各樣的攻擊。只有相當熟練的戰士能夠應付於它的笨重的性質。重甲不會讓你把你的敏捷調整值加入你的護甲等級中，但若你的敏捷調整值為負數，護甲等級也不會因此受到減少。

entries.name: 環甲
entries: 這套護甲是縫上了重鐵環的皮甲。護甲上的鐵環能有效幫助抵擋劍和斧的斬擊。環甲略遜於鎖子甲，且因此通常被無法負擔更好護甲的人們穿戴。

entries.name: 鎖子甲
entries: 由交織的鐵環製成，鎖子甲還包括了一層襯墊在鎖甲下方的布料以避免擦傷和分散衝擊力。整套護甲還包含了一雙鐵手套。

entries.name: 條板甲
entries: 這套護甲是由狹長的直鐵條鉚接於穿在墊衣外層的皮襯上所製成。並以靈活的鎖子甲保護著關節。

entries.name: 全身板甲
entries: 全身板甲由特定形狀、互相扣鎖的鐵板所構成以覆蓋全身。整套全身板甲還包括一雙鐵手套、重皮靴、附面甲的頭盔、和護甲底下墊著的厚厚襯墊。皮帶和索具將整套護甲的重量平均分佈到全身。

entries: 著裝或卸除護甲所需的時間根據護甲類別而各有不同。

entries.name: 著裝
entries: 代表著穿上護甲所需要的時間。你只有在花費整段時間穿上護甲後，才能享有該護甲所提供的AC效益。

entries.name: 卸除
entries: 代表著脫下護甲所需要的時間。若有人從旁協助，則你可以將你的卸甲時間減少一半。

entries.name: 武器
entries: 你的職業會賦予你特定武器的熟練項，同時反映了該職業的專攻項目以及你最可能使用的工具。無論你偏好長劍還是長弓，你的武器和能否有效持用它的能力在冒險中將會是生死攸關的要事。
武器表紀錄了D&D世界中最常被使用的各種武器，他們的價格、重量、在命中時造成的傷害、以及任何它們所具有的特殊屬性。每個武器都被分類為近戰或遠程武器。一把近戰武器被用以攻擊一個距離你5呎內的目標，而遠程武器則會被用以攻擊一個位於特定距離內的目標。

entries.name: 武器熟練
entries: 你的種族、職業、和專長可以賦予你特定武器或武器種類的熟練項。其中，兩種武器類型分別為簡易武器和軍用武器。大部分人們都可以熟練地使用簡易武器。這些武器包括棍棒、硬頭錘、和其他經常被平民使用的武器。而軍用武器，包括劍、斧、和長柄武器，都需要受過更專門的訓練才能被有效地使用。大部分的戰士都會使用軍用武器，以便於展現出他們的戰鬥風格並充分發揮其訓練的結果。
熟練於武器能讓你將你的熟練加值加入任何你以該武器進行的攻擊檢定中。若你使用一把你不熟練的武器進行一次攻擊檢定，則你不能將熟練加值加入該攻擊檢定中。

entries.name: 武器屬性
entries: 許多武器都具有與它使用時有關的特殊屬性，如武器表所示。

entries.name: 彈藥
entries: 你只能在擁有該武器射擊所需要的彈藥時，才能使用具有彈藥屬性的武器進行一次遠程攻擊。每次你使用該武器攻擊，你消耗一發彈藥。從箭袋、盒子、或其他容器抽出彈藥被視為該攻擊的一部份。裝填單手武器需要一隻空手。在戰鬥結束後，你可以藉由花費一分鐘的時間搜索戰場，以拿回一半你所消耗掉的彈藥量。
如果你使用具有彈藥屬性的武器進行一次近戰攻擊，你將該武器視作臨時武器（參見本段落中後述的「臨時武器」）。投石索必須要在已裝填的情況下才能以這種方式造成傷害。

entries.name: 靈巧
entries: 當你使用靈巧武器進行攻擊時，你可以選擇在該次攻擊檢定和傷害骰中使用你的力量或敏捷調整值。這兩次擲骰必須使用相同的調整值。

entries.name: 重型
entries: 小型生物在使用重型武器進行攻擊時會承受劣勢。重型武器的尺寸和重量使它對小型生物而言太過龐大而無法有效使用。

entries.name: 輕型
entries: 輕型武器小而易用，讓其相當適合被用於雙武器戰鬥。參見第九章的雙武器戰鬥規則。

entries.name: 裝填
entries: 由於裝填此武器所需的時間，當你使用動作、附贈動作、或反應以該武器射擊時，無論你原本可以進行幾次攻擊，你都只能用其射出一發彈藥。

entries.name: 射程
entries: 可以被用來進行遠程攻擊的武器，都會在彈藥或投擲屬性後用括號標示射程。射程列有兩個數字。第一個是該武器的正常射程，第二個則代表著武器的長射程。當攻擊處於正常射程之外的目標時，你在該攻擊檢定上承受劣勢。你不能攻擊處於武器長射程之外的目標。

entries.name: 觸及
entries: 當你使用此武器攻擊時，此武器讓你的觸及距離增加5呎。這個屬性也影響你使用觸及武器進行藉機攻擊的觸及距離。

entries.name: 特殊
entries: 具有特殊屬性的武器有著獨特的規則以處理其使用，詳情請參閱該武器的描述（參見本段落中後述的「特殊武器」）。

entries.name: 投擲
entries: 如果一把武器具有投擲屬性，則你可以投擲此武器以進行一次遠程攻擊。如果該武器是一把近戰武器，則你在該攻擊檢定和傷害骰中使用與你用其進行近戰攻擊時相同的屬性調整值。舉例來說，若你投擲一把手斧，則你使用你的力量。但如果你投擲的是一把匕首，由於匕首具有靈巧屬性，因此你可以從你的力量或敏捷中擇一使用。

entries.name: 雙手
entries: 此武器需要雙手使用。這個屬性只關聯於你使用此武器攻擊時，而非單純持握它的時候。

entries.name: 可雙手
entries: 此武器可以被單手或雙手使用。這個屬性後方所顯示括號內的傷害數值，代表著以雙手使用此武器進行一次近戰攻擊時的傷害。

entries.name: 臨時武器
entries: 有時候當角色們沒帶著自己的武器，而不得不用手邊隨便什麼東西來進行攻擊。這些臨時武器包括了任何你可以用單手或雙手持用的物體，像是碎玻璃、桌腳、平底鍋、馬車的車輪、或一隻死哥布林。
在許多情況下，一把臨時武器與一把真正的武器相似，且可以被做為真正的武器使用。舉例來說，一根桌腳就很像一根棍棒。根據DM的判斷，熟練於一把武器的角色可以在使用類似物體攻擊時，將之如同揮舞該武器一樣使用他或她的熟練加值。
一個與任何武器都不相似的物體將造成1d4的傷害（由DM決定適合該物體的傷害類型）。若一個角色使用一把遠程武器以進行一次近戰攻擊，或將不具有投擲屬性的近戰武器投擲出去，則其也將造成1d4點傷害。一把臨時投擲武器具有20呎的正常射程和60呎的長射程。

entries.name: 銀質武器
entries: 有些對非魔法武器具有抗性或免疫能力的怪物仍會受到銀質武器的傷害，因此有些謹慎的冒險者們會投資額外的錢財為他們的武器鍍銀。你可以用100金幣為一把武器或十發彈藥鍍銀。這些花費不僅代表了銀本身的價格，也包括了在不減損其效能的前提下鍍銀於武器上所需的時間和專業知識。

entries.name: 特殊武器
entries: 具有特殊規則的武器被記述於此。

entries.name: 騎槍
entries: 你在使用騎槍攻擊距離你5呎內的目標時承受劣勢。並且當你非騎乘時，你必須使用雙手以持握騎槍。

entries.name: 捕網
entries: 體型為大型或更小的生物在被捕網命中時將被束縛，持續直到它被釋放。捕網對於不定型生物、或體型為巨型或以上的生物沒有任何效果。生物可以使用他的動作以進行一次DC10的力量檢定，成功則釋放他自己或位於他觸及距離內的另一個生物。對捕網（AC10）造成5點劈砍傷害同樣可以釋放該生物而不會傷害到他。當你使用動作、附贈動作、或反應以捕網攻擊時，無論你原本可以進行幾次攻擊，你都只能進行一次攻擊。

entries.name: 冒險裝備
entries: 這個章節記載了那些有著特殊規則或需要進一步解釋的物品。

entries.name: 強酸
entries: 以一個動作，你可以將小瓶中的內容物潑在一名距離你5呎內的生物、或將小瓶丟到最遠20呎，讓其在衝擊中碎裂。無論是哪一種情況，對目標生物或物件進行一次遠程攻擊，將強酸瓶視作臨時武器。若命中，目標受到2d6酸蝕傷害。

entries.name: 熾火膠
entries: 這瓶黏稠的流體將在暴露於空氣時起火燃燒。以一個動作，你可以投擲這個扁瓶最遠20呎，讓它在衝擊中破碎。對一個生物或物體進行一次遠程攻擊，將熾火膠視作臨時武器。若命中，目標在每次它的回合開始時受到1d4火焰傷害。結束這個傷害效果，一個生物可以藉由使用它的動作進行一次DC 10的敏捷檢定以撲滅火焰。

entries.name: 解毒劑
entries: 飲用這瓶液體的生物在1小時內獲得對毒素的豁免檢定優勢。它對於不死生物和構裝體沒有效果。

entries.name: 奧術法器
entries: 奧術法器是一種被設計成能用以引導奧秘法術能量的特殊物品，像是水晶、法球、權杖、特製法杖、魔杖般的長木條、或是其他類似的物品。術士、契術師、或法師可以將這類物品作為法器使用，參見第十章的說明。

entries.name: 滾珠
entries: 以一個動作，你可以將這些小鐵珠從袋中散落，覆蓋一個10平方呎的平面區域。一個移動經過被覆蓋區域的生物必須成功通過一次DC 10的敏捷豁免，否則摔倒伏地。一個以半速移動經過該區域的生物不需要進行該豁免檢定。

entries.name: 滑輪組
entries: 一組纜繩串連的滑輪，以及一個用以裝上物體的鉤子，一組滑輪組讓你能夠吊起最多四倍於你正常所能舉起的重量。

entries.name: 書
entries: 一本書可能包含了詩集、歷史紀錄、與特定領域知識有關的資料、地侏發明品的示意圖和筆記、或任何其它可以用文字或圖片呈現的內容。一本記錄著法術的書則是法術書（於本節稍後介紹）。

entries.name: 鐵蒺藜
entries: 以一個動作，你可以將一袋鐵蒺藜灑落覆蓋一個5呎平方的區域。任何進入該區域的生物必須成功通過一次DC 15的敏捷豁免，否則停止移動並受到1穿刺傷害。直到該生物回復至少1點生命值之前，它的步行速度將減少10呎。一個以半速移動經過該區域的生物不需要進行該豁免檢定。

entries.name: 蠟燭
entries: 一根蠟燭可以燃燒1小時，散發出5呎半徑的明亮光照和再延伸5呎的微光光照。

entries.name: 弩矢匣
entries: 這個木製小盒可以容納最多20支弩矢。

entries.name: 地圖或卷軸筒
entries: 這個圓筒狀的皮套可以容納最多10張卷起的紙或5張捲起的羊皮紙。

entries.name: 鎖鍊
entries: 一條鎖鏈具有10點生命值。透過成功通過一次DC 20的力量檢定可以將它給掙斷。

entries.name: 攀爬工具組
entries: 這套工具組包括了一些特殊岩釘、鞋釘、手套、和一個保護帶。你能夠以一個動作使用攀爬工具組以固定你自己；若你這麼做，則你不會從你固定自己的地方摔落超過25呎，且你在解除固定之前也無法從你固定自己的地方攀爬超過25呎。

entries.name: 材料包
entries: 材料包是一個小巧、防水的皮革腰包，有著許多隔間，收納著所有你所需要用於施展法術的材料構材或其他特殊道具。但它並不包括那些有著指定價格（記載於法術敘述中）的構材。

entries.name: 撬棍
entries: 在撬棍的槓桿原理可以適用的地方使用撬棍可以讓相應的力量檢定獲得優勢。

entries.name: 德魯伊法器
entries: 德魯伊法器可以是一枝槲寄生或冬青、一根紫衫木或其它特殊木材製作的魔杖或節杖，一根從活樹上折下的法杖、或是一個含有來自神聖動物的羽毛、毛皮、骨頭、和牙齒而製成的圖騰。德魯伊（參見玩家手冊的第三章）可以使用這類物品作為法器使用，參見第十章的說明。

entries.name: 釣魚用具
entries: 這套工具組包括了一根木質長竿、絲綢線、栓木浮標、鐵鉤、鉛墜、羽絨釣餌、以及細網。

entries.name: 醫療工具組
entries: 這套工具組是一個包含繃帶、藥膏、和夾板的皮革囊袋。這套工具組有十次使用額度。以一個動作，你可以消耗一次這套工具組的使用額度，以使一個生命值為0的生物的傷勢穩定，而不需要進行一次睿知（醫藥）檢定。

entries.name: 聖徽
entries: 聖徽是代表著一尊神明或諸神的圖像雕紋。它可能會是一個描繪有神祇代表符號的護身符、一個仔細地雕刻或鑲嵌有該符號的盾牌、或是一個裝有聖遺物殘片的小匣子。附錄B列出了關聯於多元宇宙中眾多神明的代表性徽記。牧師或聖騎士可以將這類物品作為法器使用，參見第三段「魔法的規則」的說明。要透過這個方式使用聖徽，施法者必須將之持握在手中、將它穿戴在可見之處、或將其裝在盾牌上使用。

entries.name: 聖水
entries: 以一個動作，你可以將扁瓶中的內容物潑在一個距離你5呎內的生物上、或投擲這個扁瓶最遠20呎，讓它在衝擊中破碎。
無論用哪個方式，對一個目標生物進行一次遠程攻擊，將聖水視作臨時武器。若目標為邪魔或不死生物，則它將受到2d6光耀傷害。牧師或聖騎士可以藉由施展特殊的儀式製造聖水。這個儀式需要花費1小時施展，使用價值25金幣的銀粉、並要求施法者消耗一個1環法術位。

entries.name: 狩獵陷阱
entries: 當你使用一個動作設置它，這個陷阱會形成一個鋸齒鐵環，並在一個生物踩上它中心的壓力板時猛然咬合。這個陷阱被一條重鎖鏈綁在一個固定的物體上，像是一棵樹或一根被插入地面的釘子。一個踩上壓力板的生物必須成功通過一次DC 13的敏捷豁免，否則受到1d4穿刺傷害並停止移動。此後，直到該生物從該陷阱中逃脫之前，它的移動將被限制在鎖鏈的長度內（通常為3呎長）。一個生物可以使用它的動作進行一次DC 13的力量檢定，若檢定成功則釋放自己或另一個在它觸及範圍內的生物。每一次失敗的檢定都會對受困的生物造成1 穿刺傷害。

entries.name: 油燈
entries: 一盞油燈會散發出15呎半徑的明亮光照和再延伸30呎的微光光照。一旦被點亮，每一扁瓶(1品脫)的燈油都可以讓它燃燒持續6小時。

entries.name: 牛眼提燈
entries: 一盞牛眼提燈散發出60呎錐形的明亮光照以及再延伸60呎的微光光照。一旦被點亮，每一扁瓶(1品脫)的燈油都可以讓它燃燒持續6小時。

entries.name: 附蓋提燈
entries: 一盞附蓋提燈散發出30呎半徑的明亮光照以及再延伸30呎的微光光照。一旦被點亮，每一扁瓶(1品脫)的燈油都可以讓它燃燒持續6小時。以一個動作，你可以降下燈蓋，將光照減弱為5呎半徑的微光光照。

entries.name: 鎖
entries: 這道鎖會附有一把鑰匙。一個熟練於{@item 盜賊工具|phb}的生物可以不使用該鑰匙，而藉由成功通過一次DC 15的敏捷檢定將鎖打開。你的DM可以決定是否有更好的鎖在市面上以更高的價格販售。

entries.name: 放大鏡
entries: 這面透鏡可以助你看清楚小東西。它也可以在生火時用來代替碎石和打火鐵。使用放大鏡生火需要聚焦如同陽光一般明亮的光線、可以點燃的火種、以及大約5分鐘的時間以點燃火焰。一面放大鏡可以讓你在任何用以評估或審視小型或精細物體的屬性檢定中獲得優勢。

entries.name: 鐐銬
entries: 這組金屬拘束器可以束縛住小型或中型的生物。從鐐銬中逃脫需要成功通過一次DC 20的敏捷檢定。破壞它們則需要成功通過一次DC 20的力量檢定。每一組鐐銬都附有一把鑰匙。一個熟練於{@item 盜賊工具|phb}的生物可以不使用該鑰匙，而藉由成功通過一次DC 15的敏捷檢定將鐐銬的鎖打開。鐐銬具有15點生命值。

entries.name: 野炊工具組
entries: 這個錫盒內裝有一個杯子和一組簡單的餐具。這個盒子兩面被鉗在一起，且其中一面可以被當作烹飪鍋、而另一面則作為餐盤或淺碗被使用。

entries.name: 燈油
entries: 燈油通常以可以容納1品脫的陶製扁瓶販售。以一個動作，你可以將燈油潑在一個距離你5呎內的生物上、或投擲它最遠20呎，讓它在衝擊中破碎。對一個目標生物或物體進行一次遠程攻擊，將燈油視作臨時武器。若命中，目標被燈油覆蓋。若目標在燈油乾涸之前（約1分鐘）受到任何火焰傷害，則目標將因燃燒的燈油而受到額外的5點火焰傷害。你也可以將扁瓶中的燈油倒在地面，只要該表面為平面，燈油將可以覆蓋一塊5呎平方的區域。若被點燃，則燈油將燃燒持續2輪，並對任何進入該區域或在該區域結束它回合的生物造成5點火焰傷害。一個生物每回合只會受到此傷害一次。

entries.name: 基礎毒藥
entries: 你可以使用這個小瓶內的塗藥塗抹在一把劈砍或穿刺武器、或最多三發的彈藥上。塗抹毒藥需要花費一個動作。一個被中毒武器或彈藥命中的生物必須成功通過一次DC 10的體質豁免，否則受到1d4毒素傷害。一旦被塗抹，毒藥將在乾涸前維持效力長達1分鐘。

entries.name: 治療藥水
entries: 飲用這個小瓶內魔法紅色液體的角色將回復2d4+2點生命值。飲用或餵食一瓶藥水需要一個動作。

entries.name: 囊袋
entries: 一個布質或皮製的囊袋可以收納最多20個投石索彈丸、50支吹箭、或其他東西。一個用以收納法術材料的分類囊袋被稱作材料包。

entries.name: 箭袋
entries: 一個箭袋可以容納最多20枝箭。

entries.name: 便攜型攻城鎚
entries: 你可以使用便攜型攻城鎚破門。當你這麼做時，你在力量檢定中獲得+4加值。一個其他角色可以協助你使用攻城鎚，讓你在該檢定中獲得優勢。

entries.name: 口糧
entries: 口糧是由適合長途旅行的乾燥食物所組成，包括肉乾、果乾、硬麵餅、和堅果。

entries.name: 麻繩(50呎)
entries: 繩索，無論是由大麻或絲綢製成，都具有2點生命值，且可以藉由一次DC 17的力量檢定將它給掙斷。

entries.name: 絲繩(50呎)
entries: 繩索，無論是由大麻或絲綢製成，都具有2點生命值，且可以藉由一次DC 17的力量檢定將它給掙斷。

entries.name: 商用天秤
entries: 一副天秤包括了秤、盤面、以及總重最多2磅的各式砝碼。你可以使用天秤精準地測量小型物體的重量，像是貴金屬或貿易商品，以幫助你判定它們的價值。

entries.name: 法術書
entries: 對法師而言不可或缺，法術書是一本有著100頁空白羊皮紙頁的皮封書冊，適合用於紀錄法術。

entries.name: 望遠鏡
entries: 透過望遠鏡所看到的物體影像會被放大到原本大小的兩倍。

entries.name: 帳篷
entries: 一個簡單便攜的帆布遮蔽處，一個帳篷可以睡兩個人。

entries.name: 打火匣
entries: 這個小容器內含了燧石、打火鐵、和火種（通常為浸泡過燈油的乾布料）用以生火。用其來點亮火炬 —或其它有著充沛、外露燃料的東西— 需要一個動作。點亮其它火苗則需要1分鐘。

entries.name: 火炬
entries: 一支火炬可以燃燒1小時，提供20呎半徑的明亮光照和再延伸20呎的微光光照。如果你使用燃燒中的火炬進行一次近戰攻擊，它會造成1火焰傷害。

entries.caption: 容器容量
rows: 扁瓶 或 啤酒杯
footnotes: * 你也可以將像是睡袋或一卷繩子等道具綁在背包外側。

entries.name: 裝備套裝
entries: 你從你職業所獲得的起始裝備包括了一組將一系列實用的冒險裝備打包在一起的套裝。這些套裝的內容如下列所示。若你選擇自行購買你的起始裝備，則你能夠以相應的價格購買這些套裝，這麼做可能會比你分別購買其中的物品要來的更便宜。

entries.name: 竊賊套裝 (16 金幣)
entries: 包括了一個背包、一袋1,000粒的滾珠、10呎弦線、一個鈴鐺、5根蠟燭、一根撬棍、一把鐵鎚、10根岩釘、一盞附蓋提燈、2瓶燈油、5天份的口糧、一、打火匣、和一個水袋。這個套裝側邊還捆著一條50呎的麻繩。

entries.name: 大使套裝 (39 金幣)
entries: 包括了一個箱子、2個地圖或卷軸筒、一套高級服裝、一瓶墨水、一支墨水筆、一盞油燈、2瓶燈油、5張紙、一瓶香水、封蠟、和肥皂。

entries.name: 地城探險家套裝 (12 金幣)
entries: 包括了一個背包、一根撬棍、一把鐵鎚、10根岩釘、10支火炬、一個打火匣、10天份的口糧、和一個水袋。這個套裝側邊還捆著一條50呎的麻繩。

entries.name: 表演家套裝 (40 金幣)
entries: 包括了一個背包、一個睡袋、2套戲服、5根蠟燭、5天份的口糧、一個水袋、和一套易容工具組。

entries.name: 探索者套裝 (10 金幣)
entries: 包括了一個背包、一個睡袋、一套野炊工具組、一個打火匣、10支火炬、10天份的口糧、一個水袋。這個套裝側邊還捆著一條50呎的麻繩。

entries.name: 祭司套裝 (19 金幣)
entries: 包括了一個背包、一條毛毯、10根蠟燭、一個打火匣、一個善款盒、2塊焚香、一個香爐、一套祭祀服、2天份的口糧、和一個水袋。

entries.name: 學者套裝 (40 金幣)
entries: 包括了一個背包、一本學科書、一瓶墨水、一支墨水筆、10張羊皮紙、一小袋沙、和一把小刀。

entries.name: 工具
entries: 工具可以協助你進行一些平時難以達成的事情，像是製作或修復物品、偽造文書、開鎖等等。你的種族、職業、背景、或專長會給予你某些特定工具的熟練項。熟練於一個工具讓你得以將你的熟練加值加入任何你使用該工具所進行的屬性檢定中。工具的使用並不限定於單一屬性，這是因為工具熟練同時還代表著關於如何使用它的廣泛知識。舉例來說，DM可能會在你使用木雕師工具雕刻出精美細節時要求你進行一次敏捷檢定，或可能在你雕刻特別硬的木頭時要求你進行力量檢定。

entries.name: 工匠工具
entries: 這些特殊的工具類別包括了各種手藝或行業所需的道具。表格中列出了許多最常見的工具種類，每種都關聯於一種工藝項目。熟練於某種工匠工具，讓你可以在使用該工具工作時所進行的屬性檢定中加入你的熟練加值。每種不同的工匠工具都要求各自的熟練項。

entries.name: 易容工具組
entries: 這個囊袋裡的化妝品、染髮劑、以及小道具讓你能夠做出改變你外在面容的偽裝。熟練於這套工具組能讓你將你的熟練加值加到任何你在為了創造視覺易容時所進行的屬性檢定中。

entries.name: 偽造工具組
entries: 這個小盒子內裝有各式各樣的紙和羊皮紙、筆和墨水、印章和封蠟、金銀葉飾、和其他用以製作實體文件的可信贗品的設備。熟練於這套工具組能讓你將你的熟練加值加到任何你在為了製作實體文本贗品時所進行的屬性檢定中。

entries.name: 遊戲套組
entries: 這個項目涵蓋了各式各樣的遊戲道具，包括骰子和紙牌（用以遊玩像是三龍牌等遊戲）。一些常見的範例被列在表格中，但仍存在許多其他種類的遊戲套組。如果你熟練於某個遊戲套組．你可以在使用該套組玩遊戲時所進行的屬性檢定中加入你的熟練加值。每種不同的遊戲套組都要求各自的熟練項。

entries.name: 藥草師工具組
entries: 這套工具組包括了各式各樣的器具，像是修剪器、研钵及研杵、以及的囊袋和小瓶等，被藥草師用於製作藥物和藥水。
熟練於這套工具組能讓你將你的熟練加值加到任何你在為了辨識或應用藥草時所進行的屬性檢定中。同時，你必須要熟練於這套工具組才能製造解毒劑和治療藥水。

entries.name: 樂器
entries: 在表格中列出了許多最常見的樂器做為範例。如果你熟練於某個樂器，你可以在使用該樂器演奏時所進行的屬性檢定中加入你的熟練加值。吟遊詩人可以使用樂器作為法器施放法術，參見第三部分：魔法的規則。每種不同的樂器都要求各自的熟練項。

entries.name: 領航員工具
entries: 這一套儀器被用於海上的領航作業。熟練於領航員工具讓你能夠繪製航線圖並跟隨航線前進。此外，這些工具也能讓你將你的熟練加值加到任何你在為了避免於海上迷航時所進行的屬性檢定中。

entries.name: 製毒工具組
entries: 一套製毒工具組包括了若干小瓶、化學材料、以及其他製毒所需的裝備。熟練於這套工具組能讓你將你的熟練加值加到任何你在為了製作或使用毒藥時所進行的屬性檢定中。

entries.name: 盜賊工具
entries: 這一組工具包括了一把小銼刀、一套開鎖工具、一面附有鐵柄的小鏡、一組窄刃剪刀、以及一對鉗子。熟練於這套工具組能讓你將你的熟練加值加到任何你在為了解除陷阱或開鎖時所進行的屬性檢定中。

rows: 載具（陸上 或 水上）

entries.name: 坐騎與載具
entries: 一頭優秀的坐騎能夠助更迅速地穿越荒野，但牠的主要用途僅是為你攜帶那些會減緩你行進速度的裝備貨物。坐騎與其他動物表中列出了每種動物的速度和基本運載量。
拖曳四輪馬車、載貨車、雙輪戰車、雪橇、或運貨馬車的動物可以帶動最多等同牠基本運載量五倍的重量（包括載具本身的重量）。若有複數動物拖曳同一台載具，則牠們可以將牠們的運載量加總在一起。
D&D世界中還活躍這許多未被記錄於表中的坐騎，但牠們通常罕見且通常無法透過購買獲得。牠們包括了飛行座騎（天馬、獅鷲、駿鷹、和其他類似動物）和甚至水生坐騎（例如巨海馬）。通常來說，要獲得這類坐騎代表著你必須自己從蛋將牠撫養長大、與某個強大存在進行交易、或甚至是跟坐騎自己進行交涉。

entries.name: 護馬鎧甲
entries: 護馬鎧甲一套設計用於保護動物的頭、頸、胸、和身體的護甲。在本章節的護甲表中列出的任何護甲種類都可以被作為護馬鎧甲購買。它的價格相當於原本類人生物所穿護甲的四倍，且其重量為原本的兩倍。

entries.name: 鞍座
entries: 軍用鞍座支撐著騎手，幫助你在戰鬥中活動的坐騎上保持坐姿。它讓你在任何為了維持騎乘時所做的檢定中獲得優勢。異種鞍座則是騎乘任何水生或飛行坐騎所需的必要品。

entries.name: 載具熟練
entries: 若你熟練於某種載具（陸上或水上），則你可以困難情境中為了控制該類載具所進行的任意檢定中加入你的熟練加值。

entries.name: 划船
entries: 龍骨船和划艇主要被用於湖泊和河川。若順流而行，將水流的速度（通常為每小時3哩）加到這個載具的速度中。這些載具無法溯著任何顯著的逆流而行，但可以藉由岸邊的動物被拖到上游。假如冒險者打算將划艇攜帶上陸，則一艘划艇的重量為100磅。

entries.name: 貿易商品
entries: 大部分財富並不是以貨幣的方式呈現，而是以牲畜、穀物、土地、收稅權或者資源開採權（像是礦脈或森林）等方式衡量。
公會、貴族、和皇室掌控著世界的貿易活動。那些被授予特權的商號有權沿著特定路線展開貿易、派遣商船出發駛入世界各處的港口、或得以買賣特定商品。公會為他們所控制的商品或服務定價，決定誰可以、而誰不可以提供這些商品或服務。商人們通常直接以物易物，而不使用貨幣。貿易商品表中記載著常被用來交易的商品的價值。

entries.name: Expenses
entries: When not descending into the depths of the earth, exploring ruins for lost treasures, or waging war against the encroaching darkness, adventurers face more mundane realities. Even in a fantastical world, people require basic necessities such as shelter, sustenance, and clothing. These things cost money, although some lifestyles cost more than others.

entries.name: 生活開銷
entries: Lifestyle expenses provide you with a simple way to account for the cost of living in a fantasy world. They cover your accommodations, food and drink, and all your other necessities. Furthermore, expenses cover the cost of maintaining your equipment so you can be ready when adventure next calls.

At the start of each week or month (your choice), choose a lifestyle from the Expenses table and pay the price to sustain that lifestyle. The prices listed are per day, so if you wish to calculate the cost of your chosen lifestyle over a thirty-day period, multiply the listed price by 30. Your lifestyle might change from one period to the next, based on the funds you have at your disposal, or you might maintain the same lifestyle throughout your character's career.

Your lifestyle choice can have consequences. Maintaining a wealthy lifestyle might help you make contacts with the rich and powerful, though you run the risk of attracting thieves. Likewise, living frugally might help you avoid criminals, but you are unlikely to make powerful connections.

entries.name: 悲慘
entries: You live in inhumane conditions. With no place to call home, you shelter wherever you can, sneaking into barns, huddling in old crates, and relying on the good graces of people better off than you. A wretched lifestyle presents abundant dangers. Violence, disease, and hunger follow you wherever you go. Other wretched people covet your armor, weapons, and adventuring gear, which represent a fortune by their standards. You are beneath the notice of most people.

entries.name: 困苦
entries: You live in a leaky stable, a mud-floored hut just outside town, or a vermin-infested boarding house in the worst part of town. You have shelter from the elements, but you live in a desperate and often violent environment, in places rife with disease, hunger, and misfortune. You are beneath the notice of most people, and you have few legal protections. Most people at this lifestyle level have suffered some terrible setback. They might be disturbed, marked as exiles, or suffer from disease.

entries.name: 貧窮
entries: A poor lifestyle means going without the comforts available in a stable community. Simple food and lodgings, threadbare clothing, and unpredictable conditions result in a sufficient, though probably unpleasant, experience. Your accommodations might be a room in a flophouse or in the common room above a tavern. You benefit from some legal protections, but you still have to contend with violence, crime, and disease. People at this lifestyle level tend to be unskilled laborers, costermongers, peddlers, thieves, mercenaries, and other disreputable types.

entries.name: 簡樸
entries: A modest lifestyle keeps you out of the slums and ensures that you can maintain your equipment. You live in an older part of town, renting a room in a boarding house, inn, or temple. You don't go hungry or thirsty, and your living conditions are clean, if simple. Ordinary people living modest lifestyles include soldiers with families, laborers, students, priests, hedge wizards, and the like.

entries.name: 舒適
entries: Choosing a comfortable lifestyle means that you can afford nicer clothing and can easily maintain your equipment. You live in a small cottage in a middle-class neighborhood or in a private room at a fine inn. You associate with merchants, skilled tradespeople, and military officers.

entries.name: 富裕
entries: Choosing a wealthy lifestyle means living a life of luxury, though you might not have achieved the social status associated with the old money of nobility or royalty. You live a lifestyle comparable to that of a highly successful merchant, a favored servant of the royalty, or the owner of a few small businesses. You have respectable lodgings, usually a spacious home in a good part of town or a comfortable suite at a fine inn. You likely have a small staff of servants.

entries.name: 奢華
entries: You live a life of plenty and comfort. You move in circles populated by the most powerful people in the community. You have excellent lodgings, perhaps a townhouse in the nicest part of town or rooms in the finest inn. You dine at the best restaurants, retain the most skilled and fashionable tailor, and have servants attending to your every need. You receive invitations to the social gatherings of the rich and powerful, and spend evenings in the company of politicians, guild leaders, high priests, and nobility. You must also contend with the highest levels of deceit and treachery.
The wealthier you are, the greater the chance you will be drawn into political intrigue as a pawn or participant.

entries.name: Food, Drink, and Lodging
entries: The Food, Drink, and Lodging table gives prices for individual food items and a single night's lodging. These prices are included in your total lifestyle expenses.

entries.name: Self-Sufficiency
entries: The expenses and lifestyles described in this chapter assume that you are spending your time between adventures in town, availing yourself of whatever services you can afford—paying for food and shelter, paying townspeople to sharpen your sword and repair your armor, and so on. Some characters, though, might prefer to spend their time away from civilization, sustaining themselves in the wild by hunting, foraging, and repairing their own gear.

Maintaining this kind of lifestyle doesn't require you to spend any coin, but it is time-consuming. If you spend your time between adventures practicing a profession, as described in chapter 8, you can eke out the equivalent of a poor lifestyle. Proficiency in the Survival skill lets you live at the equivalent of a comfortable lifestyle.

entries.name: Services
entries: Adventurers can pay nonplayer characters to assist them or act on their behalf in a variety of circumstances. Most such hirelings have fairly ordinary skills, while others are masters of a craft or art, and a few are experts with specialized adventuring skills.

Some of the most basic types of hirelings appear on the Services table. Other common hirelings include any of the wide variety of people who inhabit a typical town or city, when the adventurers pay them to perform a specific task. For example, a wizard might pay a carpenter to construct an elaborate chest (and its miniature replica) for use in the {@spell Leomund's secret chest} spell. A fighter might commission a blacksmith to forge a special sword. A bard might pay a tailor to make exquisite clothing for an upcoming performance in front of the duke.

Other hirelings provide more expert or dangerous services. Mercenary soldiers paid to help the adventurers take on a hobgoblin army are hirelings, as are sages hired to research ancient or esoteric lore. If a high-level adventurer establishes a stronghold of some kind, he or she might hire a whole staff of servants and agents to run the place, from a castellan or steward to menial laborers to keep the stables clean. These hirelings often enjoy a long-term contract that includes a place to live within the stronghold as part of the offered compensation.

Skilled hirelings include anyone hired to perform a service that involves a proficiency (including weapon, tool, or skill): a mercenary, artisan, scribe, and so on. The pay shown is a minimum; some expert hirelings require more pay. Untrained hirelings are hired for menial work that requires no particular skill and can include laborers, porters, maids, and similar workers.

entries.name: Spellcasting Services
entries: People who are able to cast spells don't fall into the category of ordinary hirelings. It might be possible to find someone willing to cast a spell in exchange for coin or favors, but it is rarely easy and no established pay rates exist. As a rule, the higher the level of the desired spell, the harder it is to find someone who can cast it and the more it costs.

Hiring someone to cast a relatively common spell of {@filter 1st|spells|level=1} or {@filter 2nd|spells|level=2} level, such as {@spell cure wounds} or {@spell identify}, is easy enough in a city or town, and might cost 10 to 50 gold pieces (plus the cost of any expensive material components). Finding someone able and willing to cast a higher-level spell might involve traveling to a large city, perhaps one with a university or prominent temple. Once found, the spellcaster might ask for a service instead of payment—the kind of service that only adventurers can provide, such as retrieving a rare item from a dangerous locale or traversing a monster infested wilderness to deliver something important to a distant settlement.

entries.name: Trinkets
entries: When you make your character, you can roll once on the {@item Trinket (PHB)|phb|Trinkets} table to gain a trinket, a simple item lightly touched by mystery. The DM might also use this table. It can help stock a room in a dungeon or fill a creature's pockets.

data.name: Customization Options
entries: The combination of ability scores, race, class, and background defines your character's capabilities in the game, and the personal details you create set your character apart from every other character. Even within your class and race, you have options to fine-tune what your character can do. But a few players—with the DM's permission—want to go a step further.

Chapter 6 of the Player's Handbook defines two optional sets of rules for customizing your character: multiclassing and feats. Multiclassing lets you combine classes together, and feats are special options you can choose instead of increasing your ability scores as you gain levels. Your DM decides whether these options are available in a campaign.

entries.name: 兼職
entries: 兼職讓你得以獲得複數職業的等級。這麼做將讓你混合不同職業的能力特性以實現單一標準職業可能無法體現出的角色概念。
透過兼職規則，每當你升級時，你都可以選擇提升一個新職業的等級，而非提升你當前職業的等級。你的等級將會是你所有職業等級的總合。舉例來說，若你是一名三級法師兼二級戰士，則你將被視為一名五級角色。
隨著你等級的提升，你可能會以你原本的職業為主，而只在其他職業兼職了幾個等級。或者你可能會完全轉型，不再提升你過去的職業。甚至，你可能會開始發展第三或第四個職業。相比其他同等級的單一職業角色，你將犧牲專精以換取多樣性。

entries.name: 先決條件
entries: 獲得新職業前，你必須先滿足現有職業和新職業的屬性值要求，參見兼職先決條件表中所列出的內容。舉例來說，一名決定要兼職德魯伊的野蠻人，他的力量值和睿知值都必須為13或更高。由於缺乏起始角色所接受過的完整訓練，你在該職業上的學習速度勢必得比其他人快，而高於平均的屬性值也正反映了這種學習天賦。

entries.name: 經驗值
entries: 升級所需的經驗值永遠會根據你角色的總等級決定（如第一章的「角色升級表」所示），而非你特定職業的等級。因此，若你是一名牧師6/戰士1的角色，則你必須要獲得足夠你升級至8級的經驗值才能讓你將戰士升至2級或是將牧師升至7級。

entries.name: 生命值和生命骰
entries: 你只會在做為1級角色時獲得該職業的首級生命值。在這之後，你都只會獲得你所升級的職業中「其後生命值」欄位所記載的生命值。
你將你所有職業所賦予的生命骰加在一起以做為你的生命骰池。若這些生命骰的骰種相同，則你可以單純的將它們加總。比如說，戰士和聖騎士的生命骰都會是d10，因此若你是一名聖騎士5/戰士5的角色，則你將擁有十顆d10生命骰。若你的職業給了你不同類型的生命骰，則你必須分別記錄它們。舉例來說，若你是一名聖騎士5/牧師5，那麼你將擁有五顆d10生命骰和五顆d8生命骰。

entries.name: 熟練加值
entries: 你的熟練加值永遠會根據你角色的總等級決定（如第一章的「角色升級表」所示），而非你特定職業的等級。舉例來說，若你是一名戰士3/盜賊2的角色，則你會擁有5級角色的熟練加值，亦即+3。

entries.name: 熟練項
entries: 當你獲得新的兼職職業等級時，你只會獲得該職業一部份的起始熟練項，如兼職熟練項表中所示。

entries.name: 職業能力
entries: 當你提升某個職業的等級時，你將會獲得他在該等級的能力。然而，有些能力會在你兼職時有著一些額外規則，例如：引導神力、額外攻擊、無甲防禦、和施法。

entries.name: 引導神力
entries: 如果你已經擁有引導神力能力，且另一個職業的等級提升時也同樣賦予了你此能力，則你將獲得該職業所賦予的引導神力效果，但並不會因此獲得額外的使用次數。只有當你在某個職業中達到某個特別註明會給予額外使用次數的等級時，你才能獲得額外的使用次數。舉例來說，若你是一名牧師6/聖騎士4的角色，則因為你的牧師職業等級夠高，因此你可以在休息之間使用二次引導神力。每當你使用這個能力時，你可以從兩種職業的引導神力效果之中任選一種。

entries.name: 額外攻擊
entries: 若你獲得來自超過一個職業的額外攻擊能力，這些能力的效果並不會因此疊加。除非該能力另有說明（例如戰士版本的額外攻擊），否則你不能藉由此能力進行二次或以上的攻擊。同樣的，若你已經擁有額外攻擊，契術師的魔能祈喚中的「飢渴鋒刃」也不會再賦予你額外的攻擊次數。

entries.name: 無甲防禦
entries: 若你已經擁有無甲防禦能力，則你無法再從其他職業獲得此能力。

entries.name: 施法
entries: 你的施法能力有部分是基於你的所有施法職業的總等級，也有部分是基於你施法職業的個別等級。一旦你從多個職業中獲得施法能力，請使用以下規則。如果你兼職但只從一種職業獲得施法能力，則你遵照該職業所描述的規則。

entries.name: 已知／已準備的法術
entries: 你的每個職業將各自決定你所知道和可以準備的法術，就如同你是該職業的單一職業角色一樣。舉例來說，若你是一名遊俠4/法師3的角色，你會基於你的遊俠職業而知曉三個1環遊俠法術，而身為3級法師，你會知曉三個法師戲法，且你的法術書將會記載有十個法師法術，而其中兩個（你在法師職業升上3級時所學會的兩個）可以是2環法術。若你的智力值為16，則你可以從你的法術書中準備六個法師法術。
每個你所知曉和準備的法術都與你的其中一個職業關聯，且當你施放該法術時，你使用該職業的施法屬性。同樣的，該職業所關聯的法器（例如聖徽）也只能被用於來自該職業的法術。
若你所知曉的某個戲法的威力會在高等級時提升，則它的提升會基於你的角色等級，而非你在特定職業的等級。

entries.name: 法術位
entries: 要決定你的可用法術位，你必須將你吟遊詩人、牧師、德魯伊、術士、和法師的職業等級、你聖騎士和遊俠職業等級的一半（向下取整）、和你魔能騎士和詭術師等級的三分之一（向下取合）加總在一起，使用其總合並參照「兼職施法者」表以決定你所擁有的法術位。
若你具有超過一種的施法職業，則這張表格可能會給你環階超過你所知或可準備法術的法術位。你可以使用這些法術位，但只能用來施放你那些環階較低的法術。儘管你並沒有任何更高環階的法術，但若一個環階較低的法術（例如{@spell 燃燒之手}）在使用高環位施放時會有升級效果，則你可以使用該升級效果。
舉例來說，若你是一名先前提過的遊俠4/法師3，你將在決定你法術位的時後被視作一名5級角色：因此你會擁有四個1環法術位、三個2環法術位、和二個3環法術位。然而，你並不知曉任何3環法術或任何2環的遊俠法術。你仍然能使用這些法術位去施放你所知的法術—且可能會因此升級它們的效果。

entries.name: 契約魔法
entries: 若你同時擁有施法職業能力和契術師職業的契約魔法職業能力，則你可以使用你從契約魔法能力中獲得的法術位去施放你從施法職業能力中獲得的已知或已準備法術，你也可以使用你從施法職業能力中獲得的法術位去施放你已知的契術師法術。

entries.name: Feats
entries: A feat represents a talent or an area of expertise that gives a character special capabilities. It embodies training, experience, and abilities beyond what a class provides. See chapter 6 of the Player's Handbook for more information.

At certain levels, your class gives you the Ability Score Improvement feature. Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking that feature to take a feat of your choice instead. You can take each feat only once, unless the feat's description says otherwise.

You must meet any prerequisite specified in a feat to take that feat. If you ever lose a feat's prerequisite, you can't use that feat until you regain the prerequisite. For example, the Grappler feat requires you to have a Strength of 13 or higher. If your Strength is reduced below 13 somehow—perhaps by a withering curse—you can't benefit from the Grappler feat until your Strength is restored.

data.name: Using Ability Scores
entries: Six abilities provide a quick description of every creature's physical and mental characteristics

items: {@b Strength,} measuring physical power
{@b Dexterity,} measuring agility
{@b Constitution,} measuring endurance
{@b Intelligence,} measuring reasoning and memory
{@b Wisdom,} measuring perception and insight
{@b Charisma,} measuring force of personality

entries: Is a character muscle-bound and insightful? Brilliant and charming? Nimble and hardy? Ability scores define these qualities—a creature's assets as well as weaknesses.

The three main rolls of the game—the ability check, the saving throw, and the attack roll—rely on the six ability scores. The book's introduction describes the basic rule behind these rolls: roll a d20, add an ability modifier derived from one of the six ability scores, and compare the total to a target number.
This chapter focuses on how to use ability checks and saving throws, covering the fundamental activities that creatures attempt in the game. Rules for attack rolls appear in chapter 9.

entries.name: Ability Scores and Modifiers
entries: Each of a creature's abilities has a score, a number that defines the magnitude of that ability. An ability score is not just a measure of innate capabilities, but also encompasses a creature's training and competence in activities related to that ability.

A score of 10 or 11 is the normal human average, but adventurers and many monsters are a cut above average in most abilities. A score of 18 is the highest that a person usually reaches. Adventurers can have scores as high as 20, and monsters and divine beings can have scores as high as 30.

Each ability also has a modifier, derived from the score and ranging from -5 (for an ability score of 1) to +10 (for a score of 30). The Ability Scores and Modifiers table notes the ability modifiers for the range of possible ability scores, from 1 to 30.
To determine an ability modifier without consulting the table, subtract 10 from the ability score and then divide the total by 2 (round down).
Because ability modifiers affect almost every attack roll, ability check, and saving throw, ability modifiers come up in play more often than their associated scores.

entries.name: Advantage and Disadvantage
entries: Sometimes a special ability or spell tells you that you have advantage or disadvantage on an ability check, a saving throw, or an attack roll. When that happens, you roll a second d20 when you make the roll. Use the higher of the two rolls if you have advantage, and use the lower roll if you have disadvantage. For example, if you have disadvantage and roll a 17 and a 5, you use the 5. If you instead have advantage and roll those numbers, you use the 17.

If multiple situations affect a roll and each one grants advantage or imposes disadvantage on it, you don't roll more than one additional d20. If two favorable situations grant advantage, for example, you still roll only one additional d20.

If circumstances cause a roll to have both advantage and disadvantage, you are considered to have neither of them, and you roll one d20. This is true even if multiple circumstances impose disadvantage and only one grants advantage or vice versa. In such a situation, you have neither advantage nor disadvantage.

When you have advantage or disadvantage and something in the game, such as the halfling's Lucky trait, lets you reroll or replace the d20, you can reroll or replace only one of the dice. You choose which one. For example, if a halfling has advantage or disadvantage on an ability check and rolls a 1 and a 13, the halfling could use the Lucky trait to reroll the 1.

You usually gain advantage or disadvantage through the use of special abilities, actions, or spells. Inspiration (see chapter 4) can also give a character advantage on checks related to the character's personality, ideals, or bonds. The DM can also decide that circumstances influence a roll in one direction or the other and grant advantage or impose disadvantage as a result.

entries.name: Proficiency Bonus
entries: Characters have a proficiency bonus determined by level, as detailed in chapter 1. Monsters also have this bonus, which is incorporated in their stat blocks. The bonus is used in the rules on ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls.

Your proficiency bonus can't be added to a single die roll or other number more than once. For example, if two different rules say you can add your proficiency bonus to a Wisdom saving throw, you nevertheless add the bonus only once when you make the save.

Occasionally, your proficiency bonus might be multiplied or divided (doubled or halved, for example) before you apply it. For example, the rogue's Expertise feature doubles the proficiency bonus for certain ability checks. If a circumstance suggests that your proficiency bonus applies more than once to the same roll, you still add it only once and multiply or divide it only once.

By the same token, if a feature or effect allows you to multiply your proficiency bonus when making an ability check that wouldn't normally benefit from your proficiency bonus, you still don't add the bonus to the check. For that check your proficiency bonus is 0, given the fact that multiplying 0 by any number is still 0. For instance, if you lack proficiency in the History skill, you gain no benefit from a feature that lets you double your proficiency bonus when you make Intelligence (History) checks.
In general, you don't multiply your proficiency bonus for attack rolls or saving throws. If a feature or effect allows you to do so, these same rules apply.

entries.name: 屬性檢定
entries: 屬性檢定是用於判斷繳色或怪物的天賦和訓練是否足以克服某項挑戰。當角色或怪物嘗試進行某項有機率失敗的動作（除了攻擊以外）時，DM將會要求其進行一次屬性檢定。當不確定其結果的時候，就由骰子來決定成敗。
每一次屬性檢定，DM會決定六個屬性中哪一個與當前狀況有關，並決定該事件的難度，即該事件的難度等級(DC)。事件的難度越高，DC就會越高。常用難度等級表中顯示了最常見的各項DC數值。
進行屬性檢定的方式如下：骰一顆d20，然後加上相應的屬性調整值。
如同其他的d20檢定，加上任何適用的加減值後，將其總和與DC比較。若總和等於或超過DC，則屬性檢定成功—代表著該生物成功克服了眼前的挑戰。否則，該屬性檢定失敗，意味著該角色或怪物在該事件上沒能取得進展、或是在進展過程中遭遇了挫敗，具體情況由DM決定。

entries.name: 對抗
entries: 有時候角色們或怪物們之間的行動會出現直接對立的情況。這種情況可能會發生在雙方都想做同一件事，但只有一方能夠成功（比如說嘗試搶奪掉在地上的一個魔法戒指）。這種情況也可能發生在其中一方積極阻止另一方達成某件事情（舉例來說，當一個怪物嘗試強行開門，而冒險者們則壓著門不讓其推開）。在這些情況中，其行動的結果會透過一種特殊的屬性檢定決定，也就是對抗。
參與對抗的雙方都進行一次與他們行動相符的屬性檢定，各自加上所有適用的加減值後，並不是將總和與DC相比，而是比較他們雙方的檢定總值。檢定總值較高的參與者將在這次對抗中獲勝。角色或怪物要嘛成功達成其行動、或成功阻止了另一方的行動。
若對抗結果為平手，則情況將維持與進行對抗前相同的狀況。因此，其中一方可能會在這種平手情況下被當作獲勝。舉例來說，若兩個角色在搶奪地上戒指的對抗中平手，則雙方都沒能搶到戒指。而在怪物嘗試推開門而冒險者嘗試壓住門的對抗情況中，平手則代表著門仍然維持緊閉。

entries.name: 技能
entries: 每個屬性都各自涵蓋了廣泛的能力範疇，其中也包括角色或怪物可以熟練掌握的技能。技能代表著一項屬性在特定方面的表現，而技能熟練項則體現著個體在這個方面的集中培訓。（角色的起始技能熟練會在角色創建的過程中決定，而怪物的技能熟練則會記載於該怪物的數據欄中）。
舉例來說，一次敏捷檢定可能會反映一名角色嘗試展現體操特技、藏起一個物體、或保持隱蔽的能力。這三項敏捷相關的行動都具有關聯的技能，分別是：特技、手上把戲、和隱匿。因此，熟練於隱匿技能的角色會特別擅長進行與潛行和躲藏相關的敏捷檢定。
各項屬性值的相關技能如下列所示。（沒有任何技能與體質相關。）參見本章節中之後有關各屬性描述的段落，以查閱關於如何使用其相關技能的範例。

entries: 有時候，DM可能會要求你進行一次使用特定技能的屬性檢定──例如，「進行一次睿知（感知）檢定。」而在其他時候，玩家可能會詢問DM是否可以將特定技能的熟練加入某次檢定中。無論是哪種情況，熟練於該技能都意味著他或她可以將其熟練加值加入涉及該技能的屬性檢定中。若他不具有該技能的熟練項，則他將進行一次普通的屬性檢定。
舉例來說，若某個角色嘗試攀爬一座危險的峭壁，則DM可能會要求他進行一次力量（運動）檢定。若該角色熟練於運動技能，則該角色的熟練加值將加到力量檢定中。若該角色沒有該熟練，則他或她只進行普通的力量檢定。

entries.name: 變體：搭配不同屬性的技能
entries: 通常來說，你對某個技能的熟練只會應用於特定屬性的屬性檢定。比如說，運動技能的熟練通常只會應用於力量檢定。然而在某些情況，你的熟練項可能會適用於另一個不同屬性的檢定。在這種情況下，DM可能會要求你進行一次結合不同技能和屬性的檢定，又或者你可以主動詢問你的DM以確定你是否可以將熟練項應用於不同的屬性檢定。舉例來說，若你在必須從離島一路游到大陸上，你的DM可能會要求你進行一次屬性檢定以決定你是否有足夠的體力到達對岸。在這種情況下，你的DM可能會允許你使用你在運動技能上的熟練項，並要求你進行一次體質（運動）檢定。因此若你熟練於運動技能，你就可以如同你平常進行力量（運動）檢定一般，把你的熟練加值加入該體質檢定中。
同樣的，當你的矮人戰士故意展現出他狂猛的力量以威嚇敵人時，儘管威嚇技能原本是關聯於魅力屬性，你的DM仍可能會允許你進行一次力量（威嚇）檢定。

entries.name: 被動檢定
entries: 被動檢定是一種不需要擲骰的特殊屬性檢定。這類檢定可以反映一些頻繁重複行動的平均結果（像是一再搜索密門），或可以在DM希望不擲骰而偷偷決定角色在某些事情上是否成功時被使用（例如決定是否察覺躲藏起來的怪物）。
以下是角色的被動檢定總值的決定方式：

entries.text: 10 + 所有一般狀況下適用於該檢定的調整值

entries: 若角色在該檢定中具有優勢，將被動檢定結果加上5。若具有劣勢則減去5。在遊戲進行中，被動檢定總值將被當作一個可以被直接應用的數值。
舉例來說，若一個1級角色具有15點睿知，且熟練於感知技能，則他或她的被動睿知（感知）值就會是14。
下文中「敏捷」段落的躲藏規則、以及第八章的探索規則都會使用到被動檢定。

entries.name: 合作
entries: 有時候二名或更多的角色會一起合作以嘗試完成一件事。帶領進行嘗試的角色—或具有最高屬性調整值的角色—可以進行一次帶有優勢的屬性檢定，反映其他角色所提供的協助。在戰鬥中，這種合作需要透過採取協助動作（參見第九章）來進行。
一個角色只能在他或她可以獨自嘗試進行該行為時，才能為他人提供協助。舉例來說，你必須熟練於盜賊工具才能嘗試開鎖，因此不具備該熟練項的角色就無法協助其他角色進行開鎖。除此之外，只有在多人合作確實能提升這項任務的成效時，角色才能提供協助。有些工作（例如穿針引線）並不是那麼容易就能幫上忙。

entries.name: 團體檢定
entries: 當一群人以一個團體嘗試去完成某件事情時，DM可能會要求其進行一次團體屬性檢定。在這種情況中，那些擅長特定任務的角色將會協助那些不擅長的人。
當進行團體屬性檢定時，團體中的每一個人都需要進行一次屬性檢定。若團體中有至少一半的人成功，則團體檢定成功。否則團體檢定失敗。
團體檢定並不會經常發生，且它們通常會適用於全體角色會一起成功或失敗的情況。舉例來說，當冒險者們在沼澤中尋路時，DM可能會要求進行一次團體睿知（求生）檢定以判斷他們能否避開流沙、陷坑、和其他環境中的自然危害。若團隊中有至少一半的人成功，則檢定成功的角色們就能夠帶領他們的同伴避開危險。否則大家將一起跌撞栽進這些危害之中。

entries.name: Using Each Ability
entries: Every task that a character or monster might attempt in the game is covered by one of the six abilities. This section explains in more detail what those abilities mean and the ways they are used in the game.

entries.name: Strength
entries: Strength measures bodily power, athletic training, and the extent to which you can exert raw physical force.

entries.name: Strength Checks
entries: A Strength check can model any attempt to lift, push, pull, or break something, to force your body through a space, or to otherwise apply brute force to a situation. The Athletics skill reflects aptitude in certain kinds of Strength checks.

entries.name: Athletics
entries: Your Strength (Athletics) check covers difficult situations you encounter while climbing, jumping, or swimming. Examples include the following activities:

items: You attempt to climb a sheer or slippery cliff, avoid hazards while scaling a wall, or cling to a surface while something is trying to knock you off.
You try to jump an unusually long distance or pull off a stunt mid jump.

You struggle to swim or stay afloat in treacherous currents, storm-tossed waves, or areas of thick seaweed. Or another creature tries to push or pull you underwater or otherwise interfere with your swimming.

entries.name: Other Strength Checks
entries: The DM might also call for a Strength check when you try to accomplish tasks like the following:

items: Force open a stuck, locked, or barred door
Break free of bonds
Push through a tunnel that is too small
Hang on to a wagon while being dragged behind it
Tip over a statue
Keep a boulder from rolling

entries.name: Attack Rolls and Damage
entries: You add your Strength modifier to your attack roll and your damage roll when attacking with a melee weapon such as a mace, a battleaxe, or a javelin. You use melee weapons to make melee attacks in hand-to-hand combat, and some of them can be thrown to make a ranged attack.

entries.name: Lifting and Carrying
entries: Your Strength score determines the amount of weight you can bear. The following terms define what you can lift or carry.

entries.name: Carrying Capacity
entries: Your carrying capacity is your Strength score multiplied by 15. This is the weight (in pounds) that you can carry, which is high enough that most characters don't usually have to worry about it.

entries.name: Push, Drag, or Lift
entries: You can push, drag, or lift a weight in pounds up to twice your carrying capacity (or 30 times your Strength score). While pushing or dragging weight in excess of your carrying capacity, your speed drops to 5 feet.

entries.name: Size and Strength
entries: Larger creatures can bear more weight, whereas Tiny creatures can carry less. For each size category above Medium, double the creature's carrying capacity and the amount it can push, drag, or lift. For a Tiny creature, halve these weights.

entries.name: Variant: Encumbrance
entries: The rules for lifting and carrying are intentionally simple. Here is a variant if you are looking for more detailed rules for determining how a character is hindered by the weight of equipment. When you use this variant, ignore the Strength column of the Armor table in chapter 5.
If you carry weight in excess of 5 times your Strength score, you are encumbered, which means your speed drops by 10 feet.

If you carry weight in excess of 10 times your Strength score, up to your maximum carrying capacity, you are instead heavily encumbered, which means your speed drops by 20 feet and you have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws that use Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution.

entries.name: Dexterity
entries: Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, and balance.

entries.name: Dexterity Checks
entries: A Dexterity check can model any attempt to move nimbly, quickly, or quietly, or to keep from falling on tricky footing. The Acrobatics, Sleight of Hand, and Stealth skills reflect aptitude in certain kinds of Dexterity checks.

entries.name: Acrobatics
entries: Your Dexterity (Acrobatics) check covers your attempt to stay on your feet in a tricky situation, such as when you're trying to run across a sheet of ice, balance on a tightrope, or stay upright on a rocking ship's deck. The DM might also call for a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to see if you can perform acrobatic stunts, including dives, rolls, somersaults, and flips.

entries.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: Whenever you attempt an act of legerdemain or manual trickery, such as planting something on someone else or concealing an object on your person, make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check. The DM might also call for a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check to determine whether you can lift a coin purse off another person or slip something out of another person's pocket.

entries.name: Stealth
entries: Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check when you attempt to conceal yourself from enemies, slink past guards, slip away without being noticed, or sneak up on someone without being seen or heard.

entries.name: Other Dexterity Checks
entries: The DM might call for a Dexterity check when you try to accomplish tasks like the following:

items: Control a heavily laden cart on a steep descent
Steer a chariot around a tight turn
Pick a lock
Disable a trap
Securely tie up a prisoner
Wriggle free of bonds
Play a stringed instrument
Craft a small or detailed object

entries.name: Attack Rolls and Damage
entries: You add your Dexterity modifier to your attack roll and your damage roll when attacking with a ranged weapon, such as a sling or a longbow. You can also add your Dexterity modifier to your attack roll and your damage roll when attacking with a melee weapon that has the finesse property, such as a dagger or a rapier.

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: Depending on the armor you wear, you might add some or all of your Dexterity modifier to your Armor Class, as described in chapter 5.

entries.name: Initiative
entries: At the beginning of every combat, you roll initiative by making a Dexterity check. Initiative determines the order of creatures' turns in combat, as described in chapter 9.

entries.name: Hiding
entries: When you try to hide, make a Dexterity (Stealth) check. Until you are discovered or you stop hiding, that check's total is contested by the Wisdom (Perception) check of any creature that actively searches for signs of your presence.

You can't hide from a creature that can see you clearly, and if you make noise (such as shouting a warning or knocking over a vase), you give away your position. An invisible creature can't be seen, so it can always try to hide. Signs of its passage might still be noticed, however, and it still has to stay quiet.

In combat, most creatures stay alert for signs of danger all around, so if you come out of hiding and approach a creature, it usually sees you. However, under certain circumstances, the Dungeon Master might allow you to stay hidden as you approach a creature that is distracted, allowing you to gain advantage on an attack before you are seen.
Ultimately, the DM decides when circumstances are appropriate for hiding.

entries.name: Passive Perception
entries: When you hide, there's a chance someone will notice you even if they aren't searching. To determine whether such a creature notices you, the DM compares your Dexterity (Stealth) check with that creature's passive Wisdom (Perception) score, which equals 10 + the creature's Wisdom modifier, as well as any other bonuses or penalties. If the creature has advantage, add 5. For disadvantage, subtract 5.
For example, if a 1st-level character (with a proficiency bonus of +2) has a Wisdom of 15 (a +2 modifier) and a proficiency in Perception, he or she has a passive Wisdom (Perception) of 14.

entries.name: What Can you See?
entries: One of the main factors in determining whether you can find a hidden creature or object is how well you can see in an area, which might be lightly or heavily obscured, as explained in chapter 8.

entries.name: Constitution
entries: Constitution measures health, stamina, and vital force.

entries.name: Constitution Checks
entries: Constitution checks are uncommon, and no skills apply to Constitution checks, because the endurance this ability represents is largely passive rather than involving a specific effort on the part of a character or monster.
A Constitution check can model your attempt to push beyond normal limits, however.
The DM might call for a Constitution check when you try to accomplish tasks like the following:

items: Hold your breath
March or labor for hours without rest
Go without sleep
Survive without food or water
Quaff an entire stein of ale in one go

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: Your Constitution modifier contributes to your hit points. Typically, you add your Constitution modifier to each Hit Die you roll for your hit points.

If your Constitution modifier changes, your hit point maximum changes as well, as though you had the new modifier from 1st level. For example, if you raise your Constitution score when you reach 4th level and your Constitution modifier increases from +1 to +2, you adjust your hit point maximum as though the modifier had always been +2. So you add 3 hit points for your first three levels, and then roll your hit points for 4th level using your new modifier. Or if you're 7th level and some effect lowers your Constitution score so as to reduce your Constitution modifier by 1, your hit point maximum is reduced by 7.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries: Intelligence measures mental acuity, accuracy of recall, and the ability to reason.

entries.name: Intelligence Checks
entries: An Intelligence check comes into play when you need to draw on logic, education, memory, or deductive reasoning. The Arcana, History, Investigation, Nature, and Religion skills reflect aptitude in certain kinds of Intelligence checks.

entries.name: Arcana
entries: Your Intelligence (Arcana) check measures your ability to recall lore about spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, the planes of existence, and the inhabitants of those planes.

entries.name: History
entries: Your Intelligence (History) check measures your ability to recall lore about historical events, legendary people, ancient kingdoms, past disputes, recent wars, and lost civilizations.

entries.name: Investigation
entries: When you look around for clues and make deductions based on those clues, you make an Intelligence (Investigation) check. You might deduce the location of a hidden object, discern from the appearance of a wound what kind of weapon dealt it, or determine the weakest point in a tunnel that could cause it to collapse. Poring through ancient scrolls in search of a hidden fragment of knowledge might also call for an Intelligence (Investigation) check.

entries.name: Nature
entries: Your Intelligence (Nature) check measures your ability to recall lore about terrain, plants and animals, the weather, and natural cycles.

entries.name: Religion
entries: Your Intelligence (Religion) check measures your ability to recall lore about deities, rites and prayers, religious hierarchies, holy symbols, and the practices of secret cults.

entries.name: Other Intelligence Checks
entries: The DM might call for an Intelligence check when you try to accomplish tasks like the following:

items: Communicate with a creature without using words
Estimate the value of a precious item
Pull together a disguise to pass as a city guard
Forge a document
Recall lore about a craft or trade
Win a game of skill

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wizards use Intelligence as their spellcasting ability, which helps determine the saving throw DCs of spells they cast.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: Wisdom reflects how attuned you are to the world around you and represents perceptiveness and intuition.

entries.name: Wisdom Checks
entries: A Wisdom check might reflect an effort to read body language, understand someone's feelings, notice things about the environment, or care for an injured person. The Animal Handling, Insight, Medicine, Perception, and Survival skills reflect aptitude in certain kinds of Wisdom checks.

entries.name: Animal Handling
entries: When there is any question whether you can calm down a domesticated animal, keep a mount from getting spooked, or intuit an animal's intentions, the DM might call for a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. You also make a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check to control your mount when you attempt a risky maneuver.

entries.name: Insight
entries: Your Wisdom (Insight) check decides whether you can determine the true intentions of a creature, such as when searching out a lie or predicting someone's next move. Doing so involves gleaning clues from body language, speech habits, and changes in mannerisms.

entries.name: Medicine
entries: A Wisdom (Medicine) check lets you try to stabilize a dying companion or diagnose an illness.

entries.name: Perception
entries: Your Wisdom (Perception) check lets you spot, hear, or otherwise detect the presence of something. It measures your general awareness of your surroundings and the keenness of your senses.

For example, you might try to hear a conversation through a closed door, eavesdrop under an open window, or hear monsters moving stealthily in the forest. Or you might try to spot things that are obscured or easy to miss, whether they are orcs lying in ambush on a road, thugs hiding in the shadows of an alley, or candlelight under a closed secret door.

entries.name: Survival
entries: The DM might ask you to make a Wisdom (Survival) check to follow tracks, hunt wild game, guide your group through frozen wastelands, identify signs that owlbears live nearby, predict the weather, or avoid quicksand and other natural hazards.

entries.name: Other Wisdom Checks
entries: The DM might call for a Wisdom check when you try to accomplish tasks like the following:

items: Get a gut feeling about what course of action to follow
Discern whether a seemingly dead or living creature is undead

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Clerics, druids, and rangers use Wisdom as their spellcasting ability, which helps determine the saving throw DCs of spells they cast.

entries.name: Finding a Hidden Object
entries: When your character searches for a hidden object such as a secret door or a trap, the DM typically asks you to make a Wisdom (Perception) check. Such a check can be used to find hidden details or other information and clues that you might otherwise overlook.

In most cases, you need to describe where you are looking in order for the DM to determine your chance of success. For example, a key is hidden beneath a set of folded clothes in the top drawer of a bureau. If you tell the DM that you pace around the room, looking at the walls and furniture for clues, you have no chance of finding the key, regardless of your Wisdom (Perception) check result. You would have to specify that you were opening the drawers or searching the bureau in order to have any chance of success.

entries.name: Charisma
entries: Charisma measures your ability to interact effectively with others. It includes such factors as confidence and eloquence, and it can represent a charming or commanding personality.

entries.name: Charisma Checks
entries: A Charisma check might arise when you try to influence or entertain others, when you try to make an impression or tell a convincing lie, or when you are navigating a tricky social situation. The Deception, Intimidation, Performance, and Persuasion skills reflect aptitude in certain kinds of Charisma checks.

entries.name: Deception
entries: Your Charisma (Deception) check determines whether you can convincingly hide the truth, either verbally or through your actions. This deception can encompass everything from misleading others through ambiguity to telling outright lies. Typical situations include trying to fast-talk a guard, con a merchant, earn money through gambling, pass yourself off in a disguise, dull someone's suspicions with false assurances, or maintain a straight face while telling a blatant lie.

entries.name: Intimidation
entries: When you attempt to influence someone through overt threats, hostile actions, and physical violence, the DM might ask you to make a Charisma (Intimidation) check. Examples include trying to pry information out of a prisoner, convincing street thugs to back down from a confrontation, or using the edge of a broken bottle to convince a sneering vizier to reconsider a decision.

entries.name: Performance
entries: Your Charisma (Performance) check determines how well you can delight an audience with music, dance, acting, storytelling, or some other form of entertainment.

entries.name: Persuasion
entries: When you attempt to influence someone or a group of people with tact, social graces, or good nature, the DM might ask you to make a Charisma (Persuasion) check. Typically, you use persuasion when acting in good faith, to foster friendships, make cordial requests, or exhibit proper etiquette. Examples of persuading others include convincing a chamberlain to let your party see the king, negotiating peace between warring tribes, or inspiring a crowd of townsfolk.

entries.name: Other Charisma Checks
entries: The DM might call for a Charisma check when you try to accomplish tasks like the following:

items: Find the best person to talk to for news, rumors, and gossip
Blend into a crowd to get the sense of key topics of conversation

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Bards, paladins, sorcerers, and warlocks use Charisma as their spellcasting ability, which helps determine the saving throw DCs of spells they cast.

entries.name: 豁免檢定
entries: 豁免檢定—或被簡稱為豁免—代表著你在面對法術、陷阱、毒素、疾病、或其他類似威脅時所做的抵抗。通常來說，你並不會主動選擇進行豁免檢定；而是當你的角色或怪物受到威脅時被迫進行。
進行豁免檢定的方式如下：骰一顆d20，然後加上相應的屬性調整值。舉例來說，你會在進行敏捷豁免時使用你的敏捷調整值。
豁免檢定可以受到情境加值或罰值的影響，且可以被優勢和劣勢影響，由DM決定。
每個職業都會讓你熟練於至少二種豁免檢定。舉例來說，法師熟練於智力豁免。與技能熟練相同，熟練於一種豁免檢定讓繳色可以在使用特定屬性進行豁免檢定時加入他或她的熟練加值。有些怪物也會具有豁免檢定的熟練項。
豁免檢定的難度等級(DC)是由引發豁免的效果所決定。例如，一個由法術所引發的豁免檢定，其DC是由其施法者的施法屬性和熟練加值所決定。
豁免檢定成功或失敗所導致的結果也會記載於引發豁免的效果中。通常來說，一次成功的豁免檢定意味著該生物迴避或減弱了其效果的影響。

data.name: Adventuring
entries: Delving into the ancient tomb of horrors, slipping through the back alleys of Waterdeep, hacking a fresh trail through the thick jungles on the Isle of Dread—these are the things that Dungeons & Dragons adventures are made of. Your character in the game might explore forgotten ruins and uncharted lands, uncover dark secrets and sinister plots, and slay foul monsters. And if all goes well, your character will survive to claim rich rewards before embarking on a new adventure.

This chapter covers the basics of the adventuring life, from the mechanics of movement to the complexities of social interaction. The rules for resting are also in this chapter, along with a discussion of the activities your character might pursue between adventures.
Whether adventurers are exploring a dusty dungeon or the complex relationships of a royal court, the game follows a natural rhythm, as outlined in the book's introduction:

items: 1. The DM describes the environment.
2. The players describe what they want to do.
3. The DM narrates the results of their actions.

entries: Typically, the DM uses a map as an outline of the adventure, tracking the characters' progress as they explore dungeon corridors or wilderness regions.

The DM's notes, including a key to the map, describe what the adventurers find as they enter each new area. Sometimes, the passage of time and the adventurers' actions determine what happens, so the DM might use a time line or a flowchart to track their progress instead of a map.

entries.name: Time
entries: In situations where keeping track of the passage of time is important, the DM determines the time a task requires. The DM might use a different time scale depending on the context of the situation at hand. In a dungeon environment, the adventurers' movement happens on a scale of minutes. It takes them about a minute to creep down a long hallway, another minute to check for traps on the door at the end of the hall, and a good ten minutes to search the chamber beyond for anything interesting or valuable.

In a city or wilderness, a scale of hours is often more appropriate. Adventurers eager to reach the lonely tower at the heart of the forest hurry across those fifteen miles in just under four hours' time.
For long journeys, a scale of days works best. Following the road from Baldur's Gate to Waterdeep, the adventurers spend four uneventful days before a goblin ambush interrupts their journey.
In combat and other fast-paced situations, the game relies on rounds, a 6-second span of time described in chapter 9.

entries.name: Movement
entries: Swimming across a rushing river, sneaking down a dungeon corridor, scaling a treacherous mountain slope all sorts of movement play a key role in D&D adventures.

The DM can summarize the adventurers' movement without calculating exact distances or travel times: "You travel through the forest and find the dungeon entrance late in the evening of the third day." Even in a dungeon, particularly a large dungeon or a cave network, the DM can summarize movement between encounters: "After killing the guardian at the entrance to the ancient dwarven stronghold, you consult your map, which leads you through miles of echoing corridors to a chasm bridged by a narrow stone arch."Sometimes it's important, though, to know how long it takes to get from one spot to another, whether the answer is in days, hours, or minutes. The rules for determining travel time depend on two factors: the speed and travel pace of the creatures moving and the terrain they're moving over.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Every character and monster has a speed, which is the distance in feet that the character or monster can walk in 1 round. This number assumes short bursts of energetic movement in the midst of a life-threatening situation.
The following rules determine how far a character or monster can move in a minute, an hour, or a day.

entries.name: 旅行步調
entries: 當展開旅行時，一隊冒險者們能夠以正常、快速、或緩慢的步調移動，如旅行步調表所示。這個表格列出了隊伍在一段時間內可以移動的距離，以及該步調是否有任何效果。以快速步調移動會減弱角色們的觀察力，而以緩慢步調移動則讓他們得以隱密行動，並更謹慎地搜查行經區域（參見本章「旅途中的活動」段落以查閱更多資訊）。

entries.name: 強行軍
entries: 旅行步調表中的數據假定角色們一天僅行進了8個小時。 然而隊伍也可以選擇承擔體力耗竭的風險以強行進行超越極限的移動。
在8小時之後每一個小時的額外旅行，都能使角色們行進其旅行步調每小時旅行距離欄位的距離，且每個角色都必須在該小時的結束時進行一次體質豁免。這個豁免的DC等同於10+8小時以後的旅行時數。若豁免失敗，該角色將承受一級{@condition 力竭}（參見附錄）。

entries.name: 坐騎與載具
entries: 在短時間的旅行中(最多一個小時)，許多動物都具有比類人生物更快的移動速度。騎乘坐騎的角色可以疾馳大約一小時,並行進等同快速步調兩倍的距離。如果在每隔8到10哩處安排可替換且精力充沛的坐騎，則角色將能夠以這個步調行進更長的距離，然而這種情況在文明密集區域以外的地方相當罕見。
乘坐載貨馬車、四輪馬車、或其他陸上載具的角色可以如常選擇旅行步調。搭乘水上載具的角色則受限於船隻的速度（參見第五章），且他們並不會承受快速步調的懲罰或獲得緩慢步調的好處。根據船隻的大小和船員人數狀況，船隻可能有辦法每天旅行最多24小時。
某些特殊坐騎，像是飛馬或獅鷲、或者像是飛天魔毯等特殊載具，能夠讓你更迅速地旅行。更多關於特殊旅行方式的資料請參閱《地下城主指南》。

entries.caption: 旅行步調
rows: 被動睿知(感知)承受-5減值

entries.name: 困難地形
entries: 在旅行步調表中給定的速度都假定角色們在相對單純的地形中移動：道路、平原、或整齊的地城通道。然而冒險者們經常需要面對濃密的叢林、沼澤深處、滿地碎石的廢墟、陡峭的高山、和冰雪覆蓋的大地—這些全都被視為困難地形。
你在困難地形中將以一半的移動速度進行移動—在困難地形中每移動1呎，都需要花費2呎的移動力—因此在相同的時間內，你在困難地形中所能行進的距離都只有原本距離的一半。

entries.name: 特殊的移動模式
entries: 通常你無法僅僅依靠步行，就穿過危險的地城或是荒野地帶。冒險者們可能會需要透過攀爬、匍匐、游泳、或跳躍以到達他們想去的地方。

entries.name: 攀爬、游泳、和匍匐
entries: 當攀爬或游泳時，除非該生物具有攀爬或游泳速度，否則每移動一呎都會額外花費1呎的移動力（在困難地形時則為額外的2呎移動力）。DM也可以選擇要求角色成功通過一次力量（運動）檢定才能攀爬滑溜或立足點稀缺的垂直表面。同樣的，在湍急的水流中前進可能也會需要一次成功的力量（運動）檢定。

entries.name: 跳躍
entries: 你的力量值會決定你能夠跳多遠。

entries.name: 跳遠
entries: 當你進行一次跳遠時，若你是在10呎助跑移動後立刻進行跳躍，則你所能跨越最多等同於你的力量值呎數的距離。當你進行一次立定跳遠，則你只能跨越該距離的一半。無論使用哪種跳躍方式，每1呎你所跳躍的距離仍需要花費1呎的移動力。
這條規則假定該次跳躍中的跳躍高度並不重要，例如跨過溪流或裂隙。DM可以選擇要求你進行一次DC 10的力量（運動）檢定以跨過低矮的障礙物（不能高於跳躍距離的四分之一），像是籬笆或是矮牆。若檢定失敗，則你將撞上障礙物。
當你跳躍降落在困難地形上時，你必須成功通過一次DC 10的敏捷（特技）檢定以雙腳著地。否則你將失足伏地。

entries.name: 跳高
entries: 當你進行一次跳高時，若你是在10呎助跑移動後立刻進行跳躍，則你將跳到空中最多等同於3+你的力量調整值呎數的距離。在加上你的力量調整值後，你所能跳高的距離最少為0呎。當你進行一次立定跳高時，你只能跳到該高度的一半。無論使用哪種跳躍方式，每1呎你所跳躍的高度仍需要花費1呎的移動力。在某些環境，你的DM可能會允許你進行一次力量（運動）檢定以使你跳到比原本更高的高度。
你可以在跳躍時向上伸出你的手臂到你身高一半的高度。因此，你可以觸及等同於跳高距離加上你身高1又1/2倍的高度。

entries.name: Activity While Traveling
entries: As adventurers travel through a dungeon or the wilderness, they need to remain alert for danger, and some characters might perform other tasks to help the group's journey.

entries.name: Marching Order
entries: The adventurers should establish a marching order.
A marching order makes it easier to determine which characters are affected by traps, which ones can spot hidden enemies, and which ones are the closest to those enemies when a fight breaks out.

A character might occupy the front rank, one or more middle ranks, or the back rank. Characters in the front and back ranks need enough room to travel side by side with others in their rank. When space is too tight, the marching order must change, usually by moving characters to a middle rank.

entries.name: Fewer Than Three Ranks
entries: If an adventuring party arranges its marching order with only two ranks, they are a front rank and a back rank. If there's only one rank, it's considered a front rank.

entries.name: Stealth
entries: While traveling at a slow pace, the characters can move stealthily. As long as they're not in the open, they can try to surprise or sneak by other creatures they encounter. See the rules for hiding in chapter 7.

entries.name: Noticing Threats
entries: Use the passive Wisdom (Perception) scores of the characters to determine whether anyone in the group notices a hidden threat. The DM might decide that a threat can be noticed only by characters in a particular rank. For example, as the characters are exploring a maze of tunnels, the DM might decide that only those characters in the back rank have a chance to hear or spot a stealthy creature following the group, while characters in the front and middle ranks cannot.
While traveling at a fast pace, characters take a -5 penalty to their passive Wisdom (Perception) scores to notice hidden threats.

entries.name: Encountering Creatures
entries: If the DM determines that the adventurers encounter other creatures while they're traveling, it's up to both groups to decide what happens next. Either group might decide to attack, initiate a conversation, run away, or wait to see what the other group does.

entries.name: Surprising Foes
entries: If the adventurers encounter a hostile creature or group, the DM determines whether the adventurers or their foes might be surprised when combat erupts. See chapter 9 for more about surprise.

entries.name: Other Activities
entries: Characters who turn their attention to other tasks as the group travels are not focused on watching for danger.

These characters don't contribute their passive Wisdom (Perception) scores to the group's chance of noticing hidden threats. However, a character not watching for danger can do one of the following activities instead, or some other activity with the DM's permission.

entries.name: Navigate
entries: The character can try to prevent the group from becoming lost, making a Wisdom (Survival) check when the DM calls for it. (The Dungeon Master's Guide has rules to determine whether the group gets lost.)

entries.name: Draw a Map
entries: The character can draw a map that records the group's progress and helps the characters get back on course if they get lost. No ability check is required.

entries.name: Track
entries: A character can follow the tracks of another creature, making a Wisdom (Survival) check when the DM calls for it. (The Dungeon Master's Guide has rules for tracking.)

entries.name: Forage
entries: The character can keep an eye out for ready sources of food and water, making a Wisdom (Survival) check when the DM calls for it. (The Dungeon Master's Guide has rules for foraging.)

entries.name: Splitting Up the Party
entries: Sometimes, it makes sense to split an adventuring party, especially if you want one or more characters to scout ahead. You can form multiple parties, each moving at a different speed. Each group has its own front, middle, and back ranks.

The drawback to this approach is that the party will be split into several smaller groups in the event of an attack. The advantage is that a small group of stealthy characters moving slowly might be able to sneak past enemies that clumsier characters would alert. A pair of rogues moving at a slow pace are much harder to detect when they leave their dwarf fighter friend behind.

entries.name: 環境
entries: 本質上，冒險就包括了深入探索各種黑暗、危險、充滿神秘的場所。這個段落的規則涵蓋了冒險者們與這些地方的環境互動時其中一些最重要的方式。《地下城主指南》中則涵蓋了其他更罕見的情況。

entries.name: 墜落
entries: 從高處墜落是冒險者們最常遇見的危險之一。
在墜落著地時，墜落的生物每下墜10呎就會受到{@dice 1d6}點鈍擊傷害，最多至{@dice 20d6}。除非該生物以某種方式避免受到來自墜落的傷害，否則它將以{@condition 伏地}狀態著陸。

entries.name: 窒息
entries: 一個生物可以閉氣的時間等於 1+它的體質調整值 的分鐘數（最少30秒）。
當一個生物缺氧而窒息時，它仍可以堅挺長達等同於它的體質調整值的輪數（最少1輪）。在它的下個回合開始時，它的生命值將歸零，並陷入瀕死狀態。
若你缺氧而窒息，則除非你得以再次呼吸，否則你將無法回復生命值或使傷勢變得穩定。
舉例來說，一個體質值為14的生物可以閉氣長達3分鐘。若它開始窒息，則它必須在2輪內呼吸到空氣，才能避免生命值因此被歸零。

entries.name: 視覺與光照
entries: 大部分冒險中的主要事件—舉凡察覺危險、發現隱藏的物體、在戰鬥中命中敵人、和使用法術瞄準目標等—都極其依賴角色的視力。而黑暗環境和其他遮蔽視線的效果將會在這時構成顯著的妨礙。
一處特定區域可能會被輕度或重度遮蔽。在被{@b 輕度遮蔽}的區域，像是微光環境、薄霧籠罩、或被適中植物葉覆蓋的區域，角色將在依賴視覺的睿知（感知）檢定中具有劣勢。
{@b 重度遮蔽}的區域—例如黑暗、濃霧、或茂密植物葉覆蓋的區域—將會完全阻礙視線。一個處於重度遮蔽區域的生物將承受等同於{@condition 目盲}狀態的效果（參見附錄）。重度遮蔽的區域並不會使你目盲，但當你嘗試某個被其遮蔽的事物時，你將等同於處於目盲狀態。
在環境中，光線的存在與否會製造出三種照明程度：明亮光照、微光光照、和黑暗。
{@b 明亮光照} 可以讓大部分生物正常視物。即使是陰天也會提供明亮光照，而火炬、提燈、火焰、和其他光源也可以在特定半徑範圍內提供明亮光照。
{@b 微光光照} ，也被稱作陰暗環境，會製造出被輕度遮蔽的區域。微光光照的區域通常會做為明亮光照的光源（像是火炬）和周圍黑暗環境之間的過渡區域。薄暮和日出時的柔和光照同樣被視作微光光照。而特別明亮的滿月也可能會使整片土地沐浴在微光光照之下。
{@b 黑暗} 會製造出被重度遮蔽的區域。角色們會在戶外的夜晚時面臨黑暗（即使是在大多數月光照耀的夜晚也一樣）。其它的黑暗環境則包括缺乏照明的地下城或地下墓穴、或魔法黑暗所籠罩的區域。

entries.name: 盲視
entries: 具有盲視的生物即使不依賴視覺也可以感知其周遭特定半徑範圍內的環境。沒有眼睛的生物（像是泥怪）、以及具有回聲定位或高敏感官的生物（像是蝙蝠和真龍）都具有這種感官。

entries.name: 黑暗視覺
entries: 奇幻遊戲世界中的許多生物，特別是那些居住於地底的生物，都具有黑暗視覺。在特定半徑範圍內，具有黑暗視覺的生物可以將微光光照視作明亮光照，並將黑暗環境視作微光光照，因此黑暗環境對於這些生物而言僅會被輕度遮蔽。然而，這些生物無法辨別黑暗中的顏色，而只能看到灰黑的輪廓。

entries.name: 真實視覺
entries: 具有真實視覺的生物在特定半徑範圍內，可以看透普通或魔法黑暗、看見隱形的生物和物體、自動偵測出視覺幻象並成功通過對抗它們的豁免檢定、並看穿變形者或被魔法變形的生物的原始型態。此外，這些生物也可以看見位於乙太位面的事物。

entries.name: 進食與飲水
entries: 不吃或不喝的角色將會承受{@condition 力竭}的效果（參見附錄）。因為飢餓或口渴所造成的力竭直到該角色進食或飲用完整所需的份量之前都無法被移除。

entries.name: 進食
entries: 一個角色每天需要食用一磅的食物，且可以透過只食用半份口糧來延長這個期限。一整天只食用半磅的食物將被視為半日沒有進食。
一個角色可以連續不進食長達等同於3+他或她體質調整值的天數（最少為1）。在挨餓持續超過這個極限後的每天結束時，該角色將自動承受一級{@condition 力竭}。
在一天正常的食物攝取之後，該角色挨餓的天數將被重置至零。

entries.name: 飲水
entries: 一個角色每天需要飲用一加侖的水，或者若天氣炎熱的話，則需要每天飲用二加侖。一個只飲用一半份量的角色必須成功通過一次DC 15的體質豁免，否則將在當天結束時承受一級{@condition 力竭}。一個喝得更少的角色將自動在當天結束時承受一級{@condition 力竭}。
若角色已經承受一級或更多的{@condition 力竭}狀態，則在這兩種情況，該角色都改為增加二級的力竭。

entries.name: 物件互動
entries: 角色和環境中物體的互動在遊戲中經常會被簡化處理。玩家們告訴DM他或她的角色要做些什麼，例如拉下拉桿，而若有事情發生，則DM將描述接下來發生了什麼事。
舉例來說，一個角色可能會決定拉下拉桿，而這可能會因此導致某個閘門升起並使房間被水淹沒，或因此開啟一道附近牆上的暗門。然而，若拉桿因為生鏽而被卡住，則該角色可能就需要使勁強行拉動它。在這種情況，DM可能會要求他進行一次力量檢定，以決定該角色是否可以成功扳下拉桿。DM會基於這個任務的難度為任何這類檢定設定DC。
角色也可以使用他們的武器和法術傷害物體。物體免疫於毒素和精神傷害，但除此之外，它們就如同生物一樣可以被物理和魔法攻擊給影響。由DM決定物體的護甲等擊和生命值，且可能會設定特定物體具有對某類攻擊的抗性或免疫（舉例來說，你很難用棍棒砍斷一條繩索）。物體永遠會在力量和敏捷或免中失敗，且它們免疫於其他需要豁免檢定的效果。
當一個物體的生命值被歸零，則它被破壞。
角色也可以嘗試進行一次力量檢定以破壞一個物體。由DM決定任何這類檢定的DC。

entries.name: Social Interaction
entries: Exploring dungeons, overcoming obstacles, and slaying monsters are key parts of D&D adventures. No less important, though, are the social interactions that adventurers have with other inhabitants of the world.

Interaction takes on many forms. You might need to convince an unscrupulous thief to confess to some malfeasance, or you might try to flatter a dragon so that it will spare your life. The DM assumes the roles of any characters who are participating in the interaction that don't belong to another player at the table. Any such character is called a nonplayer character (NPC).

In general terms, an NPC's attitude toward you is described as friendly, indifferent, or hostile. Friendly NPCs are predisposed to help you, and hostile ones are inclined to get in your way. It's easier to get what you want from a friendly NPC, of course.
Social interactions have two primary aspects: roleplaying and ability checks.

entries.name: Roleplaying
entries: Roleplaying is, literally, the act of playing out a role. In this case, it's you as a player determining how your character thinks, acts, and talks.
Roleplaying is a part of every aspect of the game, and it comes to the fore during social interactions. Your character's quirks, mannerisms, and personality influence how interactions resolve.

There are two styles you can use when roleplaying your character: the descriptive approach and the active approach. Most players use a combination of the two styles. Use whichever mix of the two works best for you.

entries.name: Descriptive Approach to Roleplaying
entries: With this approach, you describe your character's words and actions to the DM and the other players. Drawing on your mental image of your character, you tell everyone what your character does and how he or she does it.

For instance, Chris plays Tordek the dwarf. Tordek has a quick temper and blames the elves of the Cloakwood for his family's misfortune. At a tavern, an obnoxious elf minstrel sits at Tordek's table and tries to strike up a conversation with the dwarf.

Chris says, "Tordek spits on the floor, growls an insult at the bard, and stomps over to the bar. He sits on a stool and glares at the minstrel before ordering another drink." In this example, Chris has conveyed Tordek's mood and given the DM a clear idea of his character's attitude and actions.
When using descriptive roleplaying, keep the following things in mind:

items: Describe your character's emotions and attitude.
Focus on your character's intent and how others might perceive it.
Provide as much embellishment as you feel comfortable with.
Don't worry about getting things exactly right. Just focus on thinking about what your character would do and describing what you see in your mind.

entries.name: Active Approach to Roleplaying
entries: If descriptive roleplaying tells your DM and your fellow players what your character thinks and does, active roleplaying shows them.

When you use active roleplaying, you speak with your character's voice, like an actor taking on a role. You might even echo your character's movements and body language. This approach is more immersive than descriptive roleplaying, though you still need to describe things that can't be reasonably acted out.
Going back to the example of Chris roleplaying Tordek above, here's how the scene might play out if Chris used active roleplaying:

Speaking as Tordek, Chris says in a gruff, deep voice, "I was wondering why it suddenly smelled awful in here. If I wanted to hear anything out of you, I'd snap your arm and enjoy your screams." In his normal voice, Chris then adds, "I get up, glare at the elf, and head to the bar."

entries.name: Results of Roleplaying
entries: The DM uses your character's actions and attitudes to determine how an NPC reacts. A cowardly NPC buckles under threats of violence. A stubborn dwarf refuses to let anyone badger her. A vain dragon laps up flattery.

When interacting with an NPC, pay close attention to the DM's portrayal of the NPC's mood, dialogue, and personality. You might be able to determine an NPC's personality traits, ideals, flaws, and bonds, then play on them to influence the NPC's attitude.

Interactions in D&D are much like interactions in real life. If you can offer NPCs something they want, threaten them with something they fear, or play on their sympathies and goals, you can use words to get almost anything you want. On the other hand, if you insult a proud warrior or speak ill of a noble's allies, your efforts to convince or deceive will fall short.

entries.name: Ability Checks
entries: In addition to roleplaying, ability checks are key in determining the outcome of an interaction.

Your roleplaying efforts can alter an NPC's attitude, but there might still be an element of chance in the situation. For example, your DM can call for a Charisma check at any point during an interaction if he or she wants the dice to play a role in determining an NPC's reactions. Other checks might be appropriate in certain situations, at your DM's discretion.

Pay attention to your skill proficiencies when thinking of how you want to interact with an NPC, and stack the deck in your favor by using an approach that relies on your best bonuses and skills. If the group needs to trick a guard into letting them into a castle, the rogue who is proficient in Deception is the best bet to lead the discussion. When negotiating for a hostage's release, the cleric with Persuasion should do most of the talking.

entries.name: 休息
entries: 儘管他們可能英勇無比，冒險者們也不可能整天每時每刻都沉浸在探索、社交、和戰鬥之中。他們需要休息時間去睡覺、進食、護理傷口、為施法重整心思靈魂、並為了未來的冒險做好準備。
冒險者可以在一天的冒險過程中進行數次短休，並在一天結束時進行一次長休。儘管這裡的文字僅提及冒險者，但任何生物都可以進行短休或長休。

entries.name: 短休
entries: 短休是一段短暫的休整時段，在至少1小時的短休期間內，各角色不能進行比飲食、閱讀、和護理傷口等更激烈的活動。
在短休結束時，角色可以花費一顆或更多的生命骰，最多花費等同該角色生命骰上限的數量（其上限等同於角色的等級）。每透過這個方式花費一顆生命骰，玩家便可以擲該生命骰並將擲骰結果加上該角色的體質調整值。該角色將回復等同於其總值的生命值（至少為0）。玩家可以在每次擲骰後選擇是否要花費額外的生命骰。角色會在完成一次長休時恢復其中一些已經花費掉的生命骰，見下文所述。

entries.name: 長休
entries: 長休是一段較久的休整時段，在至少8小時的長休期間，各角色必須進行至少6小時的睡眠並進行不超過2個小時的輕省活動，像是閱讀、交談、進食、或放哨。若這個休息期間被一段激烈活動給打斷—例如至少一小時的步行、戰鬥、施放法術、或其他類似的冒險活動，則角色必須重新開始休息才能獲得長休的好處。
在長休結束時，角色將會回復他所有失去的生命值。角色也會恢復他已經花費掉的生命骰，最多恢復其所擁有生命骰總數的一半。你在完成長休時至少會恢復一顆生命骰。
舉例來說，若一名角色擁有八顆生命骰，他或她可以在完成長休時恢復最多四顆已花費的生命骰。
一個角色在24小時內只能獲得長休的好處一次，且一個角色在長休開始時必須擁有至少1點生命值才能從中受益。

entries.name: 冒險之餘
entries: 在每一趟探索地城、與遠古邪惡的奮戰之餘，冒險者們也需要時間去休息、調養、並預備他們的下次冒險。許多冒險者也會利用這些時間去做些其他事情，項是打造武器和護甲、進行研究調查、或揮霍那些得來不易的金錢。
在某些狀況下，時間的流逝是可以被簡單帶過或概括的。當一場新的冒險開始時，DM可能會簡單地宣布一段時間過去，並讓你們描述你的角色在這段期間做了些什麼。而另外一些狀況，DM可能會希望將經過了多少時間記錄下來，並依此在幕後推動你們看不見的事件。

entries.name: 生活開銷
entries: 在每段冒險之間，你選擇一種特定水準的生活方式，並支付維持該生活風格所需的花費，參見第五章的記述。
以特定生活風格生活並不會對你的角色產生很大的影響，但你的生活風格仍可能會影響到其他人或團體與你互動的方式。舉例來說，若你過著奢華的生活風格，則你可能會比過著貧困生活時更容易影響城市中的貴族們。

entries.name: 休整期活動
entries: 在每段冒險之間，DM可能會詢問你關於你的角色在他或她的休整期會做什麼事情。休整期的時間可長可短，但每種休整期活動都需要你投入一定數量的休整天數才能使你從中獲益，且每天你都必須花費至少8個小時投入該休整期活動，才能讓該日被算入活動的進度。不過，這些天數並不需要是連續的。若你在完成相應休整期活動之後還有多餘的休整天數可以花費，則你可以繼續進行該項活動，或選擇進行另一項新的休整期活動。
休整期活動並不限於下面列出的選項。若你希望你的角色花費他或她的休整天數以進行未被涵蓋於下方的活動，則請與你的DM討論。

entries.name: 製作
entries: 你可以製作包括冒險裝備和藝術品在內的非魔法物體。你必須熟練於一個與你所嘗試製作物體有關的工具（通常是某種工匠工具）。你可能也會需要取得必要的特定材料或場所才能製作它。舉例來說，某個熟練於{@item 鐵匠工具|phb}的角色會需要一座熔爐才能夠製作刀劍或是護甲。
你每在製作上花費一天的休整天數，你就可以製作一個或多個市價總和不超過5金幣的物品，且你必須支付等同於其市價一半的材料費。若你想要製作物品的市價超過5金幣，則你可以按每天5金幣的進度逐日進行，直到你達到該物品的市價以完成製作。舉例來說，獨自打造一套全身板甲（市價1,500金幣）需要花費300天的時間。
複數角色可以合力製作一個物體，只要這些角色都具有所需工具的熟練項，且在同個場所一起工作。每個角色每天都可以為該物品的製作貢獻5金幣的進度。舉例來說，三個具有所需工具熟練，且擁有合適設備的角色可以在100天內打造出一套全身板甲，並總共花費750金幣的材料費。
當進行製作時，你可以維持簡樸的生活風格而無須支付每天1金幣的費用、或者維持舒適的生活風格而只需支付原本一半的花費（參見第五章以了解更多關於生活開銷的情報）。

entries.name: 實踐專業
entries: 你可以在冒險之餘的時間工作，讓你得以維持簡樸的生活風格而無須支付每天1金幣的費用（參見第五章以了解更多關於生活開銷的情報）。只要你持續實踐你的專業，你就可以持續享有這個好處。
若你是一個能夠提供優渥收入工作的組織中的成員，例如神廟或盜賊公會，那麼你可以改為賺取足以支付舒適生活風格的收入。
若你熟練於表演技能，並在你的休整期間運用你的表演技能，則你可以改為賺取足以支付富裕生活風格的收入。

entries.name: 調養
entries: 你可以在冒險之餘使用休整天數以從重大創傷、疾病、或毒素中恢復。
在花費三天的休整天數後，你可以進行一次DC 15的體質豁免。若豁免成功，你可以選擇下列其中一個結果：

items: 終止你身上一個妨礙你恢復生命值的效果。
在接下來的24小時，你在對抗正影響你的疾病或毒素效果時所進行的豁免檢定具有優勢。

entries.name: 研究調查
entries: 每段冒險之間的時間是進行研究調查的絕佳時機，讓你有機會仔細深入在戰役途中發掘出的謎團。研究調查可以是在圖書館中翻閱塵封破爛的古書卷冊、或在請當地人喝酒以從他們口中套出謠言斐語。
當你開始你的研究調查時，DM會決定你所調查的情報是否存在、需要花費多少休整天數以發掘它、以及你的研究調查是否存在任何限制（像是需要找到特定的對象、典籍、或場所）。DM可能也會要求你進行一次或多次的屬性檢定，像是透過一次智力（調查）檢定以找出指向你所找情報的蛛絲馬跡，或透過一次魅力（說服）檢定以獲得某人的協助。一旦達成這些條件且該情報存在，則你將會獲得你所尋找的情報。
每進行一天的研究調查，你都必須花費1金幣以支付你調查時的額外開銷。這筆花費並不包括在你平日的生活開銷中（參見第五章的敘述）。

entries.name: 訓練
entries: 你可以在冒險之餘花費時間以學習新的語言、或訓練一套新的工具。你的DM可能會允許你進行其他額外的訓練項目。
首先，你必須找到願意教導你的指導者。由DM決定這需要花費多久的時間，以及是否需要進行一次或多次的屬性檢定。
訓練過程會持續250天，且每天需要花費1金幣。在你花費所需的時間跟金錢後，你將學會新的語言，或獲得新工具的熟練項。

data.name: Combat
entries: The clatter of a sword striking against a shield. The terrible rending sound as monstrous claws tear through armor. A brilliant flash of light as a ball of flame blossoms from a wizard's spell. The sharp tang of blood in the air, cutting through the stench of vile monsters.
Roars of fury, shouts of triumph, cries of pain. Combat in D&D can be chaotic, deadly, and thrilling.

This chapter provides the rules you need for your characters and monsters to engage in combat, whether it is a brief skirmish or an extended conflict in a dungeon or on a field of battle. Throughout this chapter, the rules address you, the player or Dungeon Master.
The Dungeon Master controls all the monsters and nonplayer characters involved in combat, and each other player controls an adventurer. "You" can also mean the character or monster that you control.

items.name: 1. Determine surprise.
items.entry: The DM determines whether anyone involved in the combat encounter is surprised.

items.name: 2. Establish positions.
